git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_swift refs/changes/92/286692/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [tox] minversion = 1.6 skipsdist = True envlist = docs,linters,functional [testenv] usedevelop = True install_command = pip install -U {opts} {packages} deps = -r{toxinidir}/test-requirements.txt commands = /usr/bin/find . -type f -name "*.pyc" -delete passenv = HOME whitelist_externals = bash git rm setenv = VIRTUAL_ENV={envdir} ANSIBLE_HOST_KEY_CHECKING = False ANSIBLE_SSH_CONTROL_PATH = /tmp/%%h-%%r # TODO (odyssey4me) These are only here as they are non-standard folder # names for Ansible 1.9.x. We are using the standard folder names for # Ansible v2.x. We can remove this when we move to Ansible 2.x. ANSIBLE_ACTION_PLUGINS = {homedir}/.ansible/plugins/action ANSIBLE_CALLBACK_PLUGINS = {homedir}/.ansible/plugins/callback ANSIBLE_FILTER_PLUGINS = {homedir}/.ansible/plugins/filter ANSIBLE_LOOKUP_PLUGINS = {homedir}/.ansible/plugins/lookup # This is required as the default is the current path or a path specified # in ansible.cfg ANSIBLE_LIBRARY = {homedir}/.ansible/plugins/library # This is required as the default is '/etc/ansible/roles' or a path # specified in ansible.cfg ANSIBLE_ROLES_PATH = {homedir}/.ansible/roles:{toxinidir}/.. [testenv:docs] commands= python setup.py build_sphinx # environment used by the -infra templated docs job [testenv:venv] deps = -r{toxinidir}/test-requirements.txt commands = {posargs} [testenv:pep8] commands = # Run hacking/flake8 check for all python files bash -c "grep --recursive --binary-files=without-match \ --files-with-match '^.!.*python$' \ --exclude-dir .eggs \ --exclude-dir .git \ --exclude-dir .tox \ --exclude-dir *.egg-info \ --exclude-dir doc \ {toxinidir} | xargs flake8 --verbose" [flake8] # Ignores the following rules due to how ansible modules work in general # F403 'from ansible.module_utils.basic import *' used; # unable to detect undefined names # H303 No wildcard (*) import. ignore=F403,H303 [testenv:bashate] commands = # Run bashate check for all bash scripts # Ignores the following rules: # E003: Indent not multiple of 4 (we prefer to use multiples of 2) # E006: Line longer than 79 columns (as many scripts use jinja # templating, this is very difficult) # E040: Syntax error determined using `bash -n` (as many scripts # use jinja templating, this will often fail and the syntax # error will be discovered in execution anyway) bash -c "grep --recursive --binary-files=without-match \ --files-with-match '^.!.*\(ba\)\?sh$' \ --exclude-dir .tox \ --exclude-dir .git \ {toxinidir} | xargs bashate --error . --verbose --ignore=E003,E006,E040" [testenv:ansible-syntax] commands = rm -rf {homedir}/.ansible git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins \ {homedir}/.ansible/plugins ansible-galaxy install \ --role-file={toxinidir}/tests/ansible-role-requirements.yml \ --ignore-errors \ --force ansible-playbook -i {toxinidir}/tests/inventory \ --syntax-check \ --list-tasks \ -e "rolename={toxinidir}" \ {toxinidir}/tests/test.yml [testenv:ansible-lint] commands = ansible-lint {toxinidir}/tests/test.yml [testenv:functional] commands = rm -rf {homedir}/.ansible git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins \ {homedir}/.ansible/plugins ansible-galaxy install \ --role-file={toxinidir}/tests/ansible-role-requirements.yml \ --ignore-errors \ --force ansible-playbook -i {toxinidir}/tests/inventory \ -e "rolename={toxinidir}" \ {toxinidir}/tests/test.yml [testenv:linters] commands = {[testenv:pep8]commands} {[testenv:bashate]commands} {[testenv:ansible-lint]commands} {[testenv:ansible-syntax]commands}

commit_message:
Add BGPVPN-ROUTER-ASSOCIATION to heat plugin

This patch adds the BGPVPN-ROUTER-ASSOCIATION resource to heat.

Change-Id: Id242864f782033cfa532fc23c9118bd3b63b6af8
Partially-Implements: blueprint heat-support-bgpvpn-association
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn refs/changes/04/284204/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class BGPVPNRouterAssoc(neutron.NeutronResource): """A resource for BGPVPNRouterAssoc in neutron. """ PROPERTIES = ( BGPVPN_ID, ROUTER_ID ) = ( 'bgpvpn_id', 'router_id' ) ATTRIBUTES = ( SHOW, STATUS ) = ( 'show', 'status' ) properties_schema = { BGPVPN_ID: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('ID for the bgpvpn.'), required=True, ), ROUTER_ID: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('Router which shall be associated with the BGPVPN.'), required=True, ) } attributes_schema = { STATUS: attributes.Schema( _('Status of bgpvpn.'), ), SHOW: attributes.Schema( _('All attributes.') ), } def validate(self): super(BGPVPNRouterAssoc, self).validate() def handle_create(self): self.props = self.prepare_properties(self.properties, self.physical_resource_name()) body = self.props.copy() body.pop('bgpvpn_id') router_assoc = self.neutron().create_router_association( self.props['bgpvpn_id'], {'router_association': body}) self.resource_id_set(router_assoc['router_association']['id']) def handle_update(self, json_snippet, tmpl_diff, prop_diff): raise NotImplemented() def handle_delete(self): try: self.neutron().delete_router_association( self.resource_id, self.properties['bgpvpn_id']) except Exception as ex: self.client_plugin().ignore_not_found(ex) else: return True def _confirm_delete(self): while True: try: self._show_resource() except exception.NotFound: return def _show_resource(self): return self.neutron().show_router_association( self.resource_id, self.properties['bgpvpn_id']) 'OS::Neutron::BGPVPN-ROUTER-ASSOCIATION': BGPVPNRouterAssoc,

commit_message:
Get disabled services on init

For replication when we failover and disable a service we want
to be able to let a replicated backend come back online, so make
sure we use an appropriate db query for services and pass in the
backend_id during init.

Change-Id: I24ad4f282c3795e971bfafd110ade73891d7f096

commit_message:
Clean up driver loading in init_host

init_host currently sets self._driver_factory and self.drivers, but
those aren't used elsewhere in the code. Don't set them as instance
attributes, but rather let them be discarded after init_host.

Additionally, BaseConductorManager._get_driver appears to be a copy of
driver_factory.get_driver; just proxy over to the driver_factory method
instead.

As tests appear to enforce ordering of the drivers in init_host, use an
OrderedDict in driver_factory.drivers() to maintain this. I don't
believe this is required for correctness, however I don't intend to
change behavior in this patch.

Change-Id: I861980d4402a7b0744376c274ce15631547368f3

deleted_lines: try: return self._driver_factory[driver_name].obj except KeyError: raise exception.DriverNotFound(driver_name=driver_name) # NOTE(deva): instantiating DriverFactory may raise DriverLoadError # or DriverNotFound self._driver_factory = driver_factory.DriverFactory() """Driver factory loads all enabled drivers.""" self.drivers = self._driver_factory.names """List of driver names which this conductor supports.""" if not self.drivers: for driver_obj in driver_factory.drivers().values(): 'drivers': self.drivers}) 'drivers': self.drivers},

commit_message:
Implement base configuration for independent repository

neutron-ha-tool.py.j2 has been updated to resolve flake8 violations.
This includes removing the venv activation code, by implementing the
following change: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/275279/

Pep8 'E501: line too long' has been added to the ignore list since the
Jinja2 templated shebang line now exceeds 79 characters.

Change-Id: Ib309ee50d75a5386fbc5fb8cd40d8f6733bd7887
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron refs/changes/94/286694/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

[tox] minversion = 1.6 skipsdist = True envlist = docs,linters,functional [testenv] usedevelop = True install_command = pip install -U {opts} {packages} deps = -r{toxinidir}/test-requirements.txt commands = /usr/bin/find . -type f -name "*.pyc" -delete passenv = HOME whitelist_externals = bash git rm echo setenv = VIRTUAL_ENV={envdir} ANSIBLE_HOST_KEY_CHECKING = False ANSIBLE_SSH_CONTROL_PATH = /tmp/%%h-%%r # TODO (odyssey4me) These are only here as they are non-standard folder # names for Ansible 1.9.x. We are using the standard folder names for # Ansible v2.x. We can remove this when we move to Ansible 2.x. ANSIBLE_ACTION_PLUGINS = {homedir}/.ansible/plugins/action ANSIBLE_CALLBACK_PLUGINS = {homedir}/.ansible/plugins/callback ANSIBLE_FILTER_PLUGINS = {homedir}/.ansible/plugins/filter ANSIBLE_LOOKUP_PLUGINS = {homedir}/.ansible/plugins/lookup # This is required as the default is the current path or a path specified # in ansible.cfg ANSIBLE_LIBRARY = {homedir}/.ansible/plugins/library # This is required as the default is '/etc/ansible/roles' or a path # specified in ansible.cfg ANSIBLE_ROLES_PATH = {homedir}/.ansible/roles:{toxinidir}/.. [testenv:docs] commands= python setup.py build_sphinx # environment used by the -infra templated docs job [testenv:venv] deps = -r{toxinidir}/test-requirements.txt commands = {posargs} [testenv:pep8] commands = # Run hacking/flake8 check for all python files bash -c "grep --recursive --binary-files=without-match \ --files-with-match '^.!.*python$' \ --exclude-dir .eggs \ --exclude-dir .git \ --exclude-dir .tox \ --exclude-dir *.egg-info \ --exclude-dir doc \ {toxinidir} | xargs flake8 --verbose" [flake8] # Ignores the following rules due to how ansible modules work in general # F403 'from ansible.module_utils.basic import *' used; # unable to detect undefined names # H303 No wildcard (*) import. ignore=F403,H303 [testenv:bashate] commands = # Run bashate check for all bash scripts # Ignores the following rules: # E003: Indent not multiple of 4 (we prefer to use multiples of 2) # E006: Line longer than 79 columns (as many scripts use jinja # templating, this is very difficult) # E040: Syntax error determined using `bash -n` (as many scripts # use jinja templating, this will often fail and the syntax # error will be discovered in execution anyway) bash -c "grep --recursive --binary-files=without-match \ --files-with-match '^.!.*\(ba\)\?sh$' \ --exclude-dir .tox \ --exclude-dir .git \ {toxinidir} | xargs bashate --error . --verbose --ignore=E003,E006,E040" [testenv:ansible-syntax] commands = rm -rf {homedir}/.ansible git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins \ {homedir}/.ansible/plugins ansible-galaxy install \ --role-file={toxinidir}/tests/ansible-role-requirements.yml \ --ignore-errors \ --force ansible-playbook -i {toxinidir}/tests/inventory \ --syntax-check \ --list-tasks \ -e "rolename={toxinidir}" \ {toxinidir}/tests/test.yml [testenv:ansible-lint] commands = ansible-lint {toxinidir}/tests/test.yml [testenv:functional] commands = echo -e "
 *******************************************************
" \ "**** Functional Testing is still to be implemented ****
" \ "**** TODO: Write tests here ****
" \ "*******************************************************
" # As a temporary measure, while functional testing is being worked on, we # will not execute the functional test. This allows other patches to be # worked on while the functional testing is being worked out. #rm -rf {homedir}/.ansible #git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins \ # {homedir}/.ansible/plugins #ansible-galaxy install \ # --role-file={toxinidir}/tests/ansible-role-requirements.yml \ # --ignore-errors \ # --force #ansible-playbook -i {toxinidir}/tests/inventory \ # -e "rolename={toxinidir}" \ # -vv \ # {toxinidir}/tests/test.yml [testenv:linters] commands = {[testenv:pep8]commands} {[testenv:bashate]commands} {[testenv:ansible-lint]commands} {[testenv:ansible-syntax]commands}

commit_message:
Disable yum verify SSL certificates/hosts at all

Disable SSL certificates check since we can have self signed
certs for yum repos

Change-Id: I297d3fa458ee4172255bdb9013f2d2fc9a42e8ca
Closes-bug: #1541934

Clean initial registered messages

Remove clutter at startup when we log the list of registered resources.

subject: Enable builtinGlobals for no-redeclare
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-11 15:46:45.000000000', 'files': ['.eslintrc'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/eslint-config-openstack/commit/d5acf57357c26bfb6dd1a1ee7779283ead1daf0b', 'message': 'Enable builtinGlobals for no-redeclare

This adds the builtinGlobals flag to the no-redeclare rule, which
will throw errors when known globals - such as Object, Array,
window, document, etc - are used as variable names.

http://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-redeclare

Change-Id: I36b94c69cdb1fbe5f42b99aec06af01205002cf6
'}]
commit_message:
Enable builtinGlobals for no-redeclare

This adds the builtinGlobals flag to the no-redeclare rule, which
will throw errors when known globals - such as Object, Array,
window, document, etc - are used as variable names.

http://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-redeclare

Change-Id: I36b94c69cdb1fbe5f42b99aec06af01205002cf6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/eslint-config-openstack refs/changes/87/265887/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: no-redeclare: - 2 - builtinGlobals: true

commit_message:
Add commands for Network IP Availability

This patch adds commandline for getting details about
networks IP availability.

Change-Id: Ie02c01ed8c4e291f91ed4cfd8781f4ec6a612cc7
Co-Authored-By: Brandon Logan <brandon.logan@rackspace.com>
Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import sys from neutronclient.neutron.v2_0 import network_ip_availability from neutronclient.tests.unit import test_cli20 class CLITestV20NetworkIPAvailability(test_cli20.CLITestV20Base): def test_list_network_ip_availability(self): resources = "network_ip_availability" cmd = network_ip_availability.ListIpAvailability(test_cli20.MyApp (sys.stdout), None) self._test_list_resources(resources, cmd)

commit_message:
Do not pass both port-id and fixed-ip to create server

Nova doesn't allow specify port-id and fixed-ip at the same
time when create server. This patch to avoid this problem
when create internal port by subnet.

Also, this change adds integration test for create server
with subnet and fixed_ip.

Change-Id: Ib16d7f90a4eb488a853f9c2093280596fc4d783b
Partial-Bug: #1533074
(cherry picked from commit 84564a3665b07c13b4e3909a7d7949388c1f5c6c)

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from heat_integrationtests.functional import functional_base server_with_sub_fixed_ip_template = ''' heat_template_version: 2016-04-08 description: Test template to test nova server with subnet and fixed_ip. parameters: flavor: type: string image: type: string resources: net: type: OS::Neutron::Net properties: name: my_net subnet: type: OS::Neutron::Subnet properties: network: {get_resource: net} cidr: 11.11.11.0/24 server: type: OS::Nova::Server properties: image: {get_param: image} flavor: {get_param: flavor} networks: - subnet: {get_resource: subnet} fixed_ip: 11.11.11.11 outputs: networks: value: {get_attr: [server, networks]} ''' class CreateServerTest(functional_base.FunctionalTestsBase): def setUp(self): super(CreateServerTest, self).setUp() def get_outputs(self, stack_identifier, output_key): stack = self.client.stacks.get(stack_identifier) output = self._stack_output(stack, output_key) return output def test_create_server_with_subnet_fixed_ip(self): parms = {'flavor': self.conf.minimal_instance_type, 'image': self.conf.minimal_image_ref} stack_identifier = self.stack_create( template=server_with_sub_fixed_ip_template, stack_name='server_with_sub_ip', parameters=parms) networks = self.get_outputs(stack_identifier, 'networks') self.assertEqual(['11.11.11.11'], networks['my_net'])

subject: Fix tests checking for nova-compute
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-28 16:00:58.000000000', 'files': ['labs/osbash/scripts/test/launch_instance_private_net.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/training-labs/commit/57cd541b2c541efd0e8fab7cf63167712a0ab4f2', 'message': 'Fix tests checking for nova-compute

This patch improves the code in launch_instance_private_net that waits
for nova-compute services:

1) It fixes a bug introduced in commit cb70154499f (Get admin credentials
   for service list) which changed the grep pattern but not the loop
   condition which should have switched from "while" to "until". The
   bug was hidden by a race: if the service were up already for the
   first test a few lines above, the buggy code was not executed. If
   the service were still down by the time of the second test, the
   failing test was taken as a success. Only if the service came up
   between these two tests did the loop hang forever.

2) Another test for nova-compute is changed in the same way: test
   for a sign of success rather for the absense of a sign of failure
   (which could also be due to a complete failure of the command).

3) The first test for nova-compute is made more strict by making the
   matching string longer.

Change-Id: I3728f89bd0011d40a88cdee9088cc580cecc87bb
'}]
commit_message:
Fix tests checking for nova-compute

This patch improves the code in launch_instance_private_net that waits
for nova-compute services:

1) It fixes a bug introduced in commit cb70154499f (Get admin credentials
   for service list) which changed the grep pattern but not the loop
   condition which should have switched from "while" to "until". The
   bug was hidden by a race: if the service were up already for the
   first test a few lines above, the buggy code was not executed. If
   the service were still down by the time of the second test, the
   failing test was taken as a success. Only if the service came up
   between these two tests did the loop hang forever.

2) Another test for nova-compute is changed in the same way: test
   for a sign of success rather for the absense of a sign of failure
   (which could also be due to a complete failure of the command).

3) The first test for nova-compute is made more strict by making the
   matching string longer.

Change-Id: I3728f89bd0011d40a88cdee9088cc580cecc87bb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-labs refs/changes/14/285814/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary setting resources.

When we find resources we should not over-write existing resources of
stack, because it will be set to None after filtering anyway.

Change-Id: I70699dee443d12e81d2e178ccbf77348885b2b1a

commit_message:
Add skipped RST files to toctree

A number of rst files were not included in any toctree, as a result they
appear to get skipped in tox and also are not navigable in the published
output at http://docs.openstack.org/developer/magnum/

commit_message:
Return 409 instead of 503 when cidr conflict

In create a network in nova-network, we should check
whether it's a conflict cidr ,but we reported 503
service unavailable to user, we should report 409
HTTPConflict.

Closes-Bug: 1541760

Change-Id: I80a07222f44017448d1877d6b821eebe462d9fec

Moved root and service user passwords to editable attributes

Root password is 'r00tme' now for backwards compatibility.
Reworked related provisioning serializer and unit tests.

commit_message:
update django_openstack_auth to use publish-to-pypi jobs

We noticed that there was no release announcement job for
django_openstack_auth, and in the process of learning why realized that
they had a custom release pipline that doesn't make sense.

Change-Id: Iad87aac47cf1b3ddd4c30365bbe81306b4403512
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Skip dsvm jobs on release note only tempest changes

This commit adds a new regex skip if to tempest and tempest-lib to
skip running the dsvm jobs if only files in the releasenotes dir are
changed.

Change-Id: Ic4b9ef9a2c85160212408db4cb6f0ea13f19a611

commit_message:
Skip long-running jobs on neutronclient doc changes

Change [1] revealed that we are running tempest or unit tests
on doc changes when there is no need to. This change introduces
a skip-if clause to save nodes and execution time for changes
that only need to be validated on pep8/docs/releasenotes jobs.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/282555/

Change-Id: I5467472d82ddcf5dc3be939458840c3c0423526e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/82/286982/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Skip non docs jobs for doc-only neutronclient changes - name: ^gate-(python-neutronclient-(python27|python34|pypy)|neutronclient-test-dsvm-functional|neutronclient-test-dsvm-functional-adv-svcs|tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-python-neutronclient)$ skip-if: - project: ^openstack/python-neutronclient$ all-files-match-any: - ^neutron/locale/.*$ - ^.*\.rst$ - ^doc/.*$ - ^releasenotes/.*$

commit_message:
Pass environment variables of proxy to tox

When a development environment is under a proxy, tox fail even if
environment variables of the proxy are set.
This patch fixes this problem.

Related bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/magnum/+bug/1465086

Change-Id: Ibeb7840efb135102089882dfd666d3e0854157bf

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-29 11:45:35.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_compute.sh', 'extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_pacemaker.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/d776fbcdd66d8be43a854424c92b0500b4de99b5', 'message': 'Write the compute upgrade script for tripleo major upgrade workflow

As part of the major upgrade workflow non-controller nodes are to
be updated by the operator, out-of-band and only after an initial
heat stack-update that invokes the upgrade of the controller nodes.

This review adds a ComputeDeliverUpgradeConfigDeployment_Step3
SoftwareDeploymentGroup to be applied only to compute nodes, and
that depends on the controllers having been upgraded after
ControllerPacemakerUpgradeConfig_Step2.

Its purpose is to deliver but not invoke the upgrade script on

at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/284722/1 for example.

Change-Id: Ic6115fc8cf5320abfcf500112ff563bde8b88661
(cherry picked from commit 55f603b7364387e8c7f9b6b67747a5fddf6e91d4)
'}]
commit_message:
Write the compute upgrade script for tripleo major upgrade workflow

As part of the major upgrade workflow non-controller nodes are to
be updated by the operator, out-of-band and only after an initial
heat stack-update that invokes the upgrade of the controller nodes.

This review adds a ComputeDeliverUpgradeConfigDeployment_Step3
SoftwareDeploymentGroup to be applied only to compute nodes, and
that depends on the controllers having been upgraded after
ControllerPacemakerUpgradeConfig_Step2.

Its purpose is to deliver but not invoke the upgrade script on
compute nodes to /root/tripleo_upgrade_node.sh .

The non-controller nodes will then be upgraded later by an
operator that will run the script provided for that purpose, like
at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/284722/1 for example.

Change-Id: Ic6115fc8cf5320abfcf500112ff563bde8b88661
(cherry picked from commit 55f603b7364387e8c7f9b6b67747a5fddf6e91d4)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/89/285989/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ComputeDeliverUpgradeConfig_Step3: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig properties: group: script config: list_join: - '' - - str_replace: template: | #!/bin/bash upgrade_level_nova_compute='UPGRADE_LEVEL_NOVA_COMPUTE' params: UPGRADE_LEVEL_NOVA_COMPUTE: {get_param: UpgradeLevelNovaCompute} - get_file: pacemaker_common_functions.sh - get_file: major_upgrade_compute.sh ComputeDeliverUpgradeConfigDeployment_Step3: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareDeploymentGroup depends_on: ControllerPacemakerUpgradeDeployment_Step2 properties: servers: {get_param: compute_servers} config: {get_resource: ComputeDeliverUpgradeConfig_Step3} input_values: {get_param: input_values}

subject: Always override X-Forwarded-Proto header for Heat
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-01 07:36:24.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/loadbalancer.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/3aefa43072d9453412376a9bdedd949e03c926a5', 'message': "Always override X-Forwarded-Proto header for Heat

Heat has the ssl middleware to handle the X-Forwarded-Proto header by
default. We override this header when SSL is enabled because we need
to, but overriding it even when we won't be terminating SSL will
prevent some attacks using this header.

Change-Id: I0b2c61cd4f47c8c08a84402af310983af752d3f2
"}]
commit_message:
Always override X-Forwarded-Proto header for Heat

Heat has the ssl middleware to handle the X-Forwarded-Proto header by
default. We override this header when SSL is enabled because we need
to, but overriding it even when we won't be terminating SSL will
prevent some attacks using this header.

Change-Id: I0b2c61cd4f47c8c08a84402af310983af752d3f2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/20/286420/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $heat_base_options = { 'http-request' => [ 'set-header X-Forwarded-Proto https if { ssl_fc }', 'set-header X-Forwarded-Proto http if !{ ssl_fc }']} $heat_ssl_options = { } $heat_options = merge($heat_base_options, $heat_ssl_options) $heat_options = $heat_base_options
deleted_lines: $heat_options = { 'http-request' => [ 'set-header X-Forwarded-Proto https if { ssl_fc }', 'set-header X-Forwarded-Proto http if !{ ssl_fc }'], } $heat_options = {}

commit_message:
Add ngSwift Django Interface

This patch adds the scaffolding for the new angular Swift
interface, but none of the static files for that interface.

The body of the interface will be added in a follow-on
patch.

To test set DISABLED = False in _1921_project_ng_containers_panel.py

Co-Author: Neill Cox <neill@ingenious.com.au>
Change-Id: Icc11167f82554dee31edc465a14be8ebbe435403

Implement base configuration for independent repository

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova refs/changes/36/286736/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [tox] minversion = 1.6 skipsdist = True envlist = docs,linters,functional [testenv] usedevelop = True install_command = pip install -U {opts} {packages} deps = -r{toxinidir}/test-requirements.txt commands = /usr/bin/find . -type f -name "*.pyc" -delete passenv = HOME whitelist_externals = bash git rm setenv = VIRTUAL_ENV={envdir} ANSIBLE_HOST_KEY_CHECKING = False ANSIBLE_SSH_CONTROL_PATH = /tmp/%%h-%%r # TODO (odyssey4me) These are only here as they are non-standard folder # names for Ansible 1.9.x. We are using the standard folder names for # Ansible v2.x. We can remove this when we move to Ansible 2.x. ANSIBLE_ACTION_PLUGINS = {homedir}/.ansible/plugins/action ANSIBLE_CALLBACK_PLUGINS = {homedir}/.ansible/plugins/callback ANSIBLE_FILTER_PLUGINS = {homedir}/.ansible/plugins/filter ANSIBLE_LOOKUP_PLUGINS = {homedir}/.ansible/plugins/lookup # This is required as the default is the current path or a path specified # in ansible.cfg ANSIBLE_LIBRARY = {homedir}/.ansible/plugins/library # This is required as the default is '/etc/ansible/roles' or a path # specified in ansible.cfg ANSIBLE_ROLES_PATH = {homedir}/.ansible/roles:{toxinidir}/.. [testenv:docs] commands= python setup.py build_sphinx # environment used by the -infra templated docs job [testenv:venv] deps = -r{toxinidir}/test-requirements.txt commands = {posargs} [testenv:pep8] commands = # Run hacking/flake8 check for all python files bash -c "grep --recursive --binary-files=without-match \ --files-with-match '^.!.*python$' \ --exclude-dir .eggs \ --exclude-dir .git \ --exclude-dir .tox \ --exclude-dir *.egg-info \ --exclude-dir doc \ {toxinidir} | xargs flake8 --verbose" [flake8] # Ignores the following rules due to how ansible modules work in general # F403 'from ansible.module_utils.basic import *' used; # unable to detect undefined names # H303 No wildcard (*) import. ignore=F403,H303 [testenv:bashate] commands = # Run bashate check for all bash scripts # Ignores the following rules: # E003: Indent not multiple of 4 (we prefer to use multiples of 2) # E006: Line longer than 79 columns (as many scripts use jinja # templating, this is very difficult) # E040: Syntax error determined using `bash -n` (as many scripts # use jinja templating, this will often fail and the syntax # error will be discovered in execution anyway) bash -c "grep --recursive --binary-files=without-match \ --files-with-match '^.!.*\(ba\)\?sh$' \ --exclude-dir .tox \ --exclude-dir .git \ {toxinidir} | xargs bashate --error . --verbose --ignore=E003,E006,E040" [testenv:ansible-syntax] commands = rm -rf {homedir}/.ansible git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins \ {homedir}/.ansible/plugins ansible-galaxy install \ --role-file={toxinidir}/tests/ansible-role-requirements.yml \ --ignore-errors \ --force ansible-playbook -i {toxinidir}/tests/inventory \ --syntax-check \ --list-tasks \ -e "rolename={toxinidir}" \ {toxinidir}/tests/test.yml [testenv:ansible-lint] commands = ansible-lint {toxinidir}/tests/test.yml [testenv:functional] commands = rm -rf {homedir}/.ansible git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins \ {homedir}/.ansible/plugins ansible-galaxy install \ --role-file={toxinidir}/tests/ansible-role-requirements.yml \ --ignore-errors \ --force ansible-playbook -i {toxinidir}/tests/inventory \ -e "rolename={toxinidir}" \ {toxinidir}/tests/test.yml [testenv:linters] commands = {[testenv:pep8]commands} {[testenv:bashate]commands} {[testenv:ansible-lint]commands} {[testenv:ansible-syntax]commands}

commit_message:
[admin-guide] Update note of block-storage Volume-backed Image

Since uploading and donloading of image data are implemented in
the Glance Cinder store, this will remove the note about the
not-implemented features, and will add some new configurations.

Change-Id: If1d40cd19195d7f144f8e91f8946f3ab1e3869ce
Depends-On: Ie228d1d95365e81881691af4cb8b170335a73868
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/13/285813/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: To make the Image-Volume in the internal tenant accessible from the Image service, the following options must be set in the ``glance_store`` section of the ``glance-api.conf`` file: - ``cinder_store_auth_address`` - ``cinder_store_user_name`` - ``cinder_store_password`` - ``cinder_store_project_name``
deleted_lines: .. note:: Currently, the cinder store of the Image services does not support uploading and downloading of image data. By this limitation, Volume-backed images can only be used to create a new volume.

commit_message:
Replace OS_TENANT_NAME => OS_PROJECT_NAME

In devstack, to use TENANT isn't recommend.
So I replace OS_TENANT_NAME to OS_PROJECT_NAME.

refer to
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/281779/

Change-Id: Iea56c4d6c797e6893afb760f0e9a1407a0458115

commit_message:
Use scheduled deletion msg while deleting node/cluster

While we delete node and cluster, the api retrun 202.
and it make sense to use 'Scheduled deletion of node/cluster'

Change-Id: Iee17ae26feae4798c73625467ad7650472646632

commit_message:
Formalise publisher API and create publisher service.

Formalise the publisher API, for both local (inter-process) and network
publishers and subscribers. Create a publisher service to have a single
point of contact binding the TCP port. Add ZMQ driver implementation.

Change-Id: Ib56fae7102ef820b209a7021b5fe76b7c3af16fb

commit_message:
LBaaS: make use of neutron_lib exceptions

Commit 87a79256c494c36f2d9597313f430b24c0110161 added shared exceptions
to neutron-lib. This patch makes use of the aforementioned library.

Change-Id: Idbdeab79d0de6730a05401d23a808d6398605b48
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas refs/changes/78/286878/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron_lib import exceptions as nexception
deleted_lines: from neutron.common import exceptions as nexception

subject: Use assert_valid_body in volume update
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-15 06:33:04.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/api/v2/volumes.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/5b001f44eeca0445c91310c58d2258389194362b', 'message': 'Use assert_valid_body in volume update

The change is to use assert_valid_body to check body in volume update,
which avoids code duplicatin.

Change-Id: Icf9d88bbf5171faed6049b909a1a94795fb006b2
'}]
commit_message:
Use assert_valid_body in volume update

The change is to use assert_valid_body to check body in volume update,
which avoids code duplicatin.

Change-Id: Icf9d88bbf5171faed6049b909a1a94795fb006b2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/81/280081/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.assert_valid_body(body, 'volume')
deleted_lines: if 'volume' not in body: msg = _("Missing required element '%s' in request body") % 'volume' raise exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=msg)

commit_message:
Schedule creating encrypted volume

Currently Nova doesn't support to attach RBD encrypted volumes
to VM: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/206576/. At the other
side, there is bugs to use encrypted volumes from NFS:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1511255

This patch is to allow encrypted volumes in iSCSI and FC backends.

Change-Id: I5301ee41533d2f35d1f69d09019d6fc0d16b7f6f
Closes-Bug: #1520402

subject: Use isinstance instead of type
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-28 07:05:29.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v2/shell.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient/commit/5c1acb91f71308b44f0005cbbad0edf4f34c00ce', 'message': "Use isinstance instead of type

With the patch sets of request_ids, the *Manager classes return
'DictWithMeta' or 'ListWithMeta' rather than 'dict' or 'list'.
This change adjust conditional statements to use isinstance when
comparing variables. Isinstance supports inheritance type checking
better than type.

The effected subcommands are:
    evacuate
    interface-list
    interface-attach
    interface-detach

Change-Id: I0c1291110c1386d2ff027cb149a5aff20019e6f7
Closes-Bug: 1550870
"}]
commit_message:
Use isinstance instead of type

With the patch sets of request_ids, the *Manager classes return
'DictWithMeta' or 'ListWithMeta' rather than 'dict' or 'list'.
This change adjust conditional statements to use isinstance when
comparing variables. Isinstance supports inheritance type checking
better than type.

The effected subcommands are:
    evacuate
    interface-list
    interface-attach
    interface-detach

Change-Id: I0c1291110c1386d2ff027cb149a5aff20019e6f7
Closes-Bug: 1550870

commit_message:
Remove support for building unsupported MapR versions

Support for bulding images for MapR 3.1.1 4.0.1 4.0.2
and mapr-spark must be removed since Sahara does not
support these versions in Mitaka release

Implements: blueprint deprecate-old-mapr-versions

Change-Id: I265007076a5031cca561a6a9096137a5d459b716

commit_message:
Add RPC handler for security group

To support cross-pod security group, we need to divide rule with
remote_group_id into rules with remote_ip_prefix since security
group id can not cross pods, so we add the following RPC handlers
to support.

(1) Given a port, find the security gruop rules associated with
it, and retrieve IP addresses in the remote groups of those rules.
So when a port is added, we know what IP addresses to allowed to
access the port. This is already implemented in Neutron plugin so
we just inherit the proper base class.

(2) Given a port, retrieve security groups that use its security
group as the remote group. So when a port is added, we can update
those security groups to add new rule to allow the new port to
access.

Security group management will be implemented in later patch.

Change-Id: Id71e655e8d6b1a4e8670eddc7d379d0c6a7998bc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tricircle refs/changes/10/281710/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.common import rpcimport neutron.db.securitygroups_db as sg_dbimport tricircle.common.topics as t_topicsfrom tricircle.network import security_groups # dummy methodclass DummyNotifier(object): def dummy_method(self, *args, **kwargs): pass def __getattr__(self, item): return self.dummy_method security_groups.TricircleSecurityGroupMixin, # we inherit SecurityGroupServerRpcMixin which requires a notifier, # but actually we do not need notification on top, so construct a # dummy notifier self.notifier = DummyNotifier() self.endpoints = [ security_groups.TricircleSecurityGroupRpcCallback()] self._setup_rpc() self.topic = t_topics.TOP_PLUGIN self.conn = rpc.create_connection(new=True) self.conn.create_consumer(self.topic, self.endpoints, fanout=False) return self.conn.consume_in_threads() def get_port_from_device(self, context, device): # device id is exactly the port id # here we use get_port implementation in base class port = self._get_port(context, device) return self._make_port_dict(port) def security_groups_for_remote_groups(self, context, groups): remote_security_group_id = sg_db.SecurityGroupRule.remote_group_id query = context.session.query(sg_db.SecurityGroupRule) query = query.filter(remote_security_group_id.in_(groups)) remote_sg_map = {} for rule in query: if rule.remote_group_id not in remote_sg_map: remote_sg_map[rule.remote_group_id] = {} if rule.security_group_id not in remote_sg_map[ rule.remote_group_id]: remote_sg_map[rule.remote_group_id][ rule.security_group_id] = [] remote_sg_map[rule.remote_group_id][rule.security_group_id].append( self._make_security_group_rule_dict(rule)) return remote_sg_map result = super(TricirclePlugin, self).create_port(context, port) sg_ids = self._get_security_groups_on_port(context, port) self._process_port_create_security_group(context, result, sg_ids) return result
deleted_lines: from neutron.db import securitygroups_db # dump method securitygroups_db.SecurityGroupDbMixin, self.endpoints = [] pass # NOTE(zhiyuan) use later # self.topic = topics.PLUGIN # self.conn = n_rpc.create_connection(new=True) # self.conn.create_consumer(self.topic, self.endpoints, fanout=False) # return self.conn.consume_in_threads() return super(TricirclePlugin, self).create_port(context, port)

commit_message:
Revert "Add new test_rebuild_instance_with_volume to cells exclude list"

This reverts commit 674531df15d30faea08a58421160816c56b4bfba

The test was breaking more than cells, it was breaking all
shared-storage backend jobs, like ceph, so it was reverted
here:

bbeab27ab8f05ad1287907222fb6b02990021885

Since the test no longer exists, we can remove it from the
blacklist.

Change-Id: Iee028a56f6a27d97011f26966b3584770d5287db

Add property 'MapR-FS heap size percent' to cluster template

User can configure service.command.mfs.heapsize.percent when
reating cluster template

Change-Id: I90894d0995e86315b984afba07ef65b46a734c47
Closes-Bug: #1541354

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-03 10:17:32.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/controller.yaml', 'puppet/swift-storage.yaml', 'puppet/compute.yaml', 'puppet/ceph-storage.yaml', 'puppet/cinder-storage.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/3c1850b780c3841ffcab1e35f81be623f0000e37', 'message': 'Add HostnameMap to allow granular control of hostnames

Some operators desire more granular control of hostnames than is
currently possible via the *HostnameFormat parameters, in particular
mapping nodes to explicit IDs (such as inventory references) is not
easily possible.

So, add a HostnameMap parameter, which is optional and allows
explicit overriding of the default hostnames.

E.g pass an environment like this:

parameter_defaults:
  HostnameMap:
    overcloud-controller-0: overcloud-controller-prod-123-0
    overcloud-controller-1: overcloud-controller-prod-456-0

Note this is mapping is global (for all roles), because we
expect the keys to be unique given that they include the
role name and index by default.

Note that this depends on a fix for heat bug #1539737

Change-Id: Ib4d3d40e9523903ebccc06c3e14b2d71d924afa3

commit_message:
Add HostnameMap to allow granular control of hostnames

Some operators desire more granular control of hostnames than is
currently possible via the *HostnameFormat parameters, in particular
mapping nodes to explicit IDs (such as inventory references) is not
easily possible.

So, add a HostnameMap parameter, which is optional and allows
explicit overriding of the default hostnames.

E.g pass an environment like this:

parameter_defaults:
  HostnameMap:
    overcloud-controller-0: overcloud-controller-prod-123-0
    overcloud-controller-1: overcloud-controller-prod-456-0
    overcloud-controller-2: overcloud-controller-prod-789-0

Note this is mapping is global (for all roles), because we
expect the keys to be unique given that they include the
role name and index by default.

Note that this depends on a fix for heat bug #1539737

Change-Id: Ib4d3d40e9523903ebccc06c3e14b2d71d924afa3
Depends-On: Ib934f443a8b8e4f75335a9d8b992e7f86791aa45
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/05/275605/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: HostnameMap: type: json default: {} description: Optional mapping to override hostnames name: str_replace: template: {get_param: Hostname} params: {get_param: HostnameMap}

commit_message:
Add service binary/host to service is down log for context

When we're logging that a service appears to be down in the
DB service group drive, add the service binary and host to
the message for context.

Change-Id: I8f676f7b498f4d7cb9b574a401ec892c2a3aacd3
Related-Bug: #1549854

commit_message:
Properly handle failures during resource cleanup

The current code that cleans-up network resouces from the dynamic
credentials provider does not account for failures during the
cleanup itself (apart from 404).

When the cleanup is triggered by a failure during the setup, the
original failure is hidden which makes debugging impossible.

Catching all exceptions on cleanup, logging a warning and
re-rasing the original exception should fix that.

Fixes bug 1551264

Change-Id: I49dbb314a09fd9b49c9604bc8b5b8ed03ff218d4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/12/286112/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use str() to generate IOError exception message

In python3 IOError has no 'message' property.

Partially-Implements: blueprint magnum-python3

Change-Id: I48f7e1304883357d7d909f742444a4d5fcdc9499

commit_message:
Remove unused domain driver method in legacy wrapper

We have already moved the domain driver methods to the V8
interface (and hence marking them as deprecated). We can also
now remove them from V9 legacy wrapper.

This doesn't affect our support for legacy drivers (since the
wrapper still calls the underlying domain driver methods), but
they are not required in the manager-wrapper interface itself.

Partially Implements: blueprint reseller

Change-Id: Ib3f9515e79ed17e30f924c05e31bc7a4f2a95fa0

commit_message:
Change "Reboot Hard" to "Hard Reboot".

While using Horizon, I noticed that the status said "Reboot Pending
Hard".  I think it makes more sense to say "Hard Reboot Pending".
Change this and a couple other similar strings.

Change-Id: I037e9ea8ae91ae4b272c90d2a47f2289ad72cd8b
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/90/286790/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: u"Rebooting Hard")), u"Reboot Pending Hard")), u"Reboot Started Hard")),

commit_message:
fix delete backup tenant_id error

When we use a api to delete a backup instance,
we should give a tenant_id to decrease quota.
But in the code,the tenant_id that invoke the api,
not the backup instance belongs,so recorrect it.

Close-Bug: #1546935

commit_message:
Disable image uplaods to vexxhost

Image uploads seem to be having trouble against vexxhost. Disable the
uploads by setting max-servers: -1 while we debug what the issue is.

Change-Id: I8353b963cdf6918938435c3d539e3182e7e15925
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/03/287003/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

it was used get the correct return value. Instead of using 'side_effect'
incorrectly, 'return_value' should be used instead.

commit_message:
Cinderclient is passed broken mock

Mock for the cinderclient is causing some interesting functionality.
Every time the get() in the VolumeManager is called, mock returns a different
value. The first time it returns the correct value then after that it
falls off the track.

The problem originated from declaring 'side_effect' as a iterator so every
time 'side_effect' was called the return value was dynamically changed [0].
Luckily no one was actually using 'side_effect' for its real use case and
it was used get the correct return value. Instead of using 'side_effect'
incorrectly, 'return_value' should be used instead.

[0]: https://docs.python.org/3/library/unittest.mock.html#the-mock-class

Change-Id: Ibdede3eab23f0417fe50284ae92ba912af033a9c
Closes-Bug: #1551252
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/61/285561/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_broken_find_resource(self): # Mock has a generator somewhere that is returning different # values every time 'self.manager.api.client.get' is called # Exception: Not Found - Which is expected to be returned self.assertRaises(Exception, self.manager.api.client.get, 'non_existent_volume') response = self.manager.api.client.get('non_existent_volume') # response = (<Mock id='139961851581648'>, # {'volumes': [{'id': '1after909', # 'display_name': 'PhilSpector'}]}) self.assertIs(type(tuple), type(response)) # Every time 'self.manager.api.client.get' is called after the 3rd call # it returns a StopIteration Exception self.assertRaises(StopIteration, self.manager.api.client.get, 'non_existent_volume')

commit_message:
Fix for adding gateway with IP outside subnet

Currently 'force_gateway_on_subnet' configuration is set to True
by default and enforces the subnet on to the gateway. With this
fix 'force_gateway_on_subnet' can be changed to False, and
gateway outside the subnet can be added.
Before adding the default route, a route to the gateway IP is
added. This applies to both external and internal networks.

Change-Id: I3a942cf98d263681802729cf09527f06c80fab2b
Closes-Bug: #1335023
Closes-Bug: #1398768
(cherry picked from commit b6126bc0f17f348ff6303b9bd6041cb018479ef9)

commit_message:
[admin-guide]Update a note for viewing all tenant IDs

In liberty, the default identity-api-version is 3. And
the keystone CLI is deprecated in this version. So we
need to use python-openstackclient.

Change-Id: Ic28a3b2173942de48d68c55f3565ea83e0180e03
Closes-Bug: #1551046

commit_message:
[config-ref] Update VMware driver cluster info

Updated VMware driver section to reflect one cluster per nova-compute
service (as of Liberty release).

Change-Id: I086259f7d179b33ab0efae1707923c7b663dcb7a
Closes-Bug: #1546741
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/97/286897/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <para>Clusters: The vCenter driver can support only a single cluster. Clusters and data stores used by the vCenter driver should not contain any VMs other than those created by the driver.</para>
deleted_lines: <para>Clusters: The vCenter driver can support multiple clusters. To use more than one cluster, simply add multiple <option>cluster_name</option> lines in <filename>nova.conf</filename> with the appropriate cluster name. Clusters and data stores used by the vCenter driver should not contain any VMs other than those created by the driver.</para>

Adding ability use default templates

We can use flags -p, -v, -r for specifying plugin, version and
release for testing sahara and will be run default scenarios for a plugin.

Change-Id: Iea65367bc3cffa2198117d245572c7d9a8260eeb

commit_message:
Remove replication v2 calls

With replication v2.1 merged in cinder and the calls merged in the
client, there is no longer a need for the old calls. If these commands
are called with the newest cinder code, it fails miserably.

Basically reverts this patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/231708

Change-Id: I29c0565c1efe518e40c3483ceb4ca0d40cd7d0d7

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary import lines from scss files

According to following changes in Horizon, some scss
importations become unnecessary.

https://review.openstack.org/277220/

And the above change occurs critical django error, so
dashboards doesn't work.

This patch removes these unnecessary importations.

Change-Id: I6041305710ae5b1832ba708fbc4cc32cf61087cb
Closes-Bug: #1550286

commit_message:
Add server_metadata function calls

This patch adds server_metadata related function calls.

Change-Id: I220d54110e6ac4650671ceb73421531df1665303
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/57/262657/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from openstack.compute.v2 import server_metadata def create_server_metadata(self, server, **attrs): """Create metadata of a server :param server: Either the ID of a server or a :class:`~openstack.compute.v2.server.Server` instance. :param kwargs \*\*attrs: The metadata created for the server. :returns: The created server_metadata :rtype: :class:`~openstack.compute.v2.server_metadata.ServerMetadata` """ server_id = resource.Resource.get_id(server) attrs.update({'server_id': server_id}) return self._create(server_metadata.ServerMetadata, path_args={'server_id': server_id}, **attrs) def get_server_metadata(self, server): """Get metadata of a server :param server: Either the ID of a server or a :class:`~openstack.compute.v2.server.Server` instance. :returns: One :class:`~openstack.compute.v2.server_metadata.ServerMetadata` :raises: :class:`~openstack.exceptions.ResourceNotFound` when no resource can be found. """ server_id = resource.Resource.get_id(server) return self._get(server_metadata.ServerMetadata, server_id, path_args={'server_id': server_id}) def update_server_metadata(self, server, **attrs): """Update metadata of a server :param server: Either the ID of a server or a :class:`~openstack.compute.v2.server.Server` instance. :param kwargs \*\*attrs: The metadata updated for the server. :returns: The updated server_metadata :rtype: :class:`~openstack.compute.v2.server_metadata.ServerMetadata` """ server_id = resource.Resource.get_id(server) return self._update(server_metadata.ServerMetadata, server_id, path_args={'server_id': server_id}, **attrs)

Add delete method for server_metadata resource

This patch adds delete method for server_metadata in both resource
and proxy layer.

Change-Id: Icb6371e3a2a40eb63e52e2a0d8be6a3c375397ba

added_lines: from openstack.compute.v2 import server_metadata def delete_server_metadata(self, server, ignore_missing=True): """Delete metadata of a server :param server: Either the ID of a server or a :class:`~openstack.compute.v2.server.Server` instance. :param bool ignore_missing: When set to ``False`` :class:`~openstack.exceptions.ResourceNotFound` will be raised when the server does not exist. When set to ``True``, no exception will be set when attempting to delete metadata of a nonexistent server. :returns: ``None`` """ server_id = resource.Resource.get_id(server) self._delete(server_metadata.ServerMetadata, server_id, path_args={'server_id': server_id}, ignore_missing=ignore_missing)

commit_message:
Tests for volumes pagination are added

test_volumes_pagination_through_admin,  test_volumes_pagination

Implements blueprint: horizon-integration-tests-coverage
Change-Id: Iacdba412f0a446eaa999180433ba740448e71b08
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/04/273004/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_volumes_pagination(self): """This test checks volumes pagination Steps: 1) Login to Horizon Dashboard as horizon user 2) Go to Project -> Compute -> Volumes -> Volumes tab and create three volumes 3) Navigate to user settings page 4) Change 'Items Per Page' value to 1 5) Go to Project -> Compute -> Volumes -> Volumes tab 6) Check that only 'Next' link is available, only one volume is available (and it has correct name) 7) Click 'Next' and check that both 'Prev' and 'Next' links are available, only one volume is available (and it has correct name) 8) Click 'Next' and check that only 'Prev' link is available, only one volume is visible (and it has correct name) 9) Click 'Prev' and check result (should be the same as for step7) 10) Click 'Prev' and check result (should be the same as for step6) 11) Go to user settings page and restore 'Items Per Page' 12) Delete created volumes """ volumes_page = self.home_pg.go_to_compute_volumes_volumespage() count = 3 items_per_page = 1 volumes_names = ["{0}_{1}".format(self.VOLUME_NAME, i) for i in xrange(count)] for volume_name in volumes_names: volumes_page.create_volume(volume_name) volumes_page.find_message_and_dismiss(messages.INFO) self.assertTrue(volumes_page.is_volume_present(volume_name)) first_page_definition = {'Next': True, 'Prev': False, 'Count': items_per_page, 'Names': [volumes_names[2]]} second_page_definition = {'Next': True, 'Prev': True, 'Count': items_per_page, 'Names': [volumes_names[1]]} third_page_definition = {'Next': False, 'Prev': True, 'Count': items_per_page, 'Names': [volumes_names[0]]} settings_page = self.home_pg.go_to_settings_usersettingspage() settings_page.change_pagesize(items_per_page) settings_page.find_message_and_dismiss(messages.SUCCESS) volumes_page = self.home_pg.go_to_compute_volumes_volumespage() volumes_page.volumes_table.assert_definition(first_page_definition) volumes_page.volumes_table.turn_next_page() volumes_page.volumes_table.assert_definition(second_page_definition) volumes_page.volumes_table.turn_next_page() volumes_page.volumes_table.assert_definition(third_page_definition) volumes_page.volumes_table.turn_prev_page() volumes_page.volumes_table.assert_definition(second_page_definition) volumes_page.volumes_table.turn_prev_page() volumes_page.volumes_table.assert_definition(first_page_definition) settings_page = self.home_pg.go_to_settings_usersettingspage() settings_page.change_pagesize() settings_page.find_message_and_dismiss(messages.SUCCESS) volumes_page = self.home_pg.go_to_compute_volumes_volumespage() for volume_name in volumes_names: volumes_page.delete_volume(volume_name) volumes_page.find_message_and_dismiss(messages.SUCCESS) self.assertTrue(volumes_page.is_volume_deleted(volume_name)) def test_volumes_pagination_through_admin(self): """This test checks volumes pagination under admin Steps: 1) Login to Horizon Dashboard as admin user 2) Go to Project -> Compute -> Volumes -> Volumes tab and create three volumes 3) Navigate to user settings page 4) Change 'Items Per Page' value to 1 5) Go to Admin -> System -> Volumes -> Volumes tab 6) Check that only 'Next' link is available, only one volume is available (and it has correct name) 7) Click 'Next' and check that both 'Prev' and 'Next' links are available, only one volume is available (and it has correct name) 8) Click 'Next' and check that only 'Prev' link is available, only one volume is visible (and it has correct name) 9) Click 'Prev' and check result (should be the same as for step7) 10) Click 'Prev' and check result (should be the same as for step6) 11) Go to user settings page and restore 'Items Per Page' 12) Delete created volumes """ volumes_page = self.home_pg.go_to_compute_volumes_volumespage() count = 3 items_per_page = 1 volumes_names = ["{0}_{1}".format(self.VOLUME_NAME, i) for i in xrange(count)] for volume_name in volumes_names: volumes_page.create_volume(volume_name) volumes_page.find_message_and_dismiss(messages.INFO) self.assertTrue(volumes_page.is_volume_present(volume_name)) first_page_definition = {'Next': True, 'Prev': False, 'Count': items_per_page, 'Names': [volumes_names[2]]} second_page_definition = {'Next': True, 'Prev': True, 'Count': items_per_page, 'Names': [volumes_names[1]]} third_page_definition = {'Next': False, 'Prev': True, 'Count': items_per_page, 'Names': [volumes_names[0]]} settings_page = self.home_pg.go_to_settings_usersettingspage() settings_page.change_pagesize(items_per_page) settings_page.find_message_and_dismiss(messages.SUCCESS) volumes_page = self.home_pg.go_to_system_volumes_volumespage() volumes_page.volumes_table.assert_definition(first_page_definition) volumes_page.volumes_table.turn_next_page() volumes_page.volumes_table.assert_definition(second_page_definition) volumes_page.volumes_table.turn_next_page() volumes_page.volumes_table.assert_definition(third_page_definition) volumes_page.volumes_table.turn_prev_page() volumes_page.volumes_table.assert_definition(second_page_definition) volumes_page.volumes_table.turn_prev_page() volumes_page.volumes_table.assert_definition(first_page_definition) settings_page = self.home_pg.go_to_settings_usersettingspage() settings_page.change_pagesize() settings_page.find_message_and_dismiss(messages.SUCCESS) volumes_page = self.home_pg.go_to_system_volumes_volumespage() for volume_name in volumes_names: volumes_page.delete_volume(volume_name) volumes_page.find_message_and_dismiss(messages.SUCCESS) self.assertTrue(volumes_page.is_volume_deleted(volume_name))

commit_message:
Disable tempest tox venv recreation in OFFLINE mode

Setting OFFLINE=True in local.conf should enable stack.sh to run multiple
times without an internet connection. This was broken for some cases
when recreation of tox venv for tempest was forced in lib/tempest.

This change makes recreation of tox venv enabled only when OFFLINE mode is
disabled.

Change-Id: I2bf6caf60038a3690378eead905b35e9175ac356
Closes-Bug: #1550537
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/71/285571/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: local recreate_arg="" if [[ "$OFFLINE" != "True" ]]; then recreate_arg="-r" fi tox -evenv --notest $recreate_arg

commit_message:
complete the removal of api_version from rest client parameters

This completes the removal of the api_version parameter from
individual rest calls. This is an attribute of the api rest client
itself, and should be set there and have all requests work on that
version.

In order to do that test_server_group had to be pretty substantially
normalized. This set of tests so aggressively used common methods
(including embedded asserts) that assumed a very specific execution
environment and didn't account for other microversion changes. This
expands this back out via copy/paste to decouple these components that
do vary.

Change-Id: I06b0087b755b0d19fb51ef0463d36dd2cac5f044

commit_message:
Allow mutable argument to be passed to BinaryObject artifacts

According to spec description [1] binary data should always be
immutable. Before this commit, passing 'mutable' argument lead
to exception, because it was passed to a function twice. This commit
makes BinaryObject's silently ignore mutable=False and raises an
appropriate exception in case mutable=True is passed.

Change-Id: Ib42871004c792b840f8af0316c3b8177c4ecf706
Closes-Bug: #1542430

commit_message:
Make debootstrap cache opt-in

Whenever we make a debootstrap based image we cache the restuling
rootfs. For the majority of cases this is a wasted expensive operation
(an extra copy of the full rootfs). Lets make it opt-in.

Change-Id: I8f5bd9e5a9b0efdce5cb78ae46afe64f07a3125d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/86/285886/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The `DIB_DEBOOTSTRAP_CACHE` environment variable determines if a cache of the resulting rootfs generated from debootstrap is stored in the dib cache (allowing for later offline runs). If this is set to a value other than 0 then the cache is created.

commit_message:
Return HTTPBadRequest error from API for immutable parameters

Return HTTPBadRequest error from API instead of
HTTPInternalServerError when immutable parameters are modified.

commit_message:
add inspected_index to get_rca

Change-Id: I4f6fda86ee5adffcd80312c966b1e184d63d660a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/vitrage refs/changes/74/286774/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: found_graph = self._get_topology(ctx, graph_type, depth, query, root) return found_graph.output_graph() def get_rca(self, ctx, graph_type, depth, query, root): found_graph = self._get_topology(ctx, graph_type, depth, query, root) found_graph['inspected_index'] = self._find_rca_index(found_graph, root) return found_graph.output_graph() def _get_topology(self, ctx, graph_type, depth, query, root): return ga.graph_query_vertices( @staticmethod def _find_rca_index(found_graph, root): root_index = 0 for vertex in found_graph._g: if vertex.vertex_id == root: break root_index += 1 return root_index

commit_message:
Add basic workflow of attach/detach to devref

This is something that confuses folks and isn't centrally
located.  So... add it to the devref docs and hope that
developers read it.

There's tons of detail we can add in the future of course,
but this at least clears up some of the common misconceptions
that exist currently.

Change-Id: Ic5fb8da06d18fac3369a91a525accc75c1d28100
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/71/285471/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License. Volume Attach/Detach workflow ============================= There are six API calls associated with attach/detach of volumes in Cinder (3 calls for each operation). This can lead to some confusion for developers trying to work on Cinder. The convention is actually quite simple, although it may be difficult to decipher from the code. Attach/Detach Operations are mulit-part commands ================================================ There are three things that happen in the workflow for an attach or detach call. 1. Update the status of the volume in the DB (ie attaching/detaching) - For Attach, this is the cinder.volume.api.reserve method - For Detach, the analagous call is cinder.volume.api.begin_detaching 2. Handle the connection operations that need to be done on the Volume - For Attach, this is the cinder.volume.api.initialize_connection method - For Detach, the analagous calls is cinder.volume.api.terminate_connection 3. Finalize the status of the volume and release the resource - For attach, this is the cinder.volume.api.attach method - For detach, the analagous call is cinder.volume.api.detach Attach workflow =============== reserve_volume(self, context, volume) ------------------------------------- Probably the most simple call in to Cinder. This method simply checks that the specified volume is in an available state and can be attached. Any other state results in an Error response notifying Nova that the volume is NOT available. The only valid state for this call to succeed is available. NOTE: multi-attach will add "in-use" to the above acceptable states. If the volume is in fact available, we immediately issue an update to the Cinder database and mark the status of the volume to attaching thereby reserving the volume so that it wont be used by another API call anywhere else. initialize_connection(self, context, volume, connector) ------------------------------------------------------- This is the only attach related API call that should be doing any significant work. This method is responsible for building and returning all of the info needed by the caller (Nova) to actually attach the specified volume to the remote node. This method returns vital information to the caller that includes things like CHAP credential, iqn and lun information. An example response is shown here: :: {driver_volume_type': iscsi, data': {auth_password': YZ2Hceyh7VySh5HY, target_discovered': False, encrypted': False, qos_specs': None, target_iqn': iqn.2010-10.org.openstack:volume-8b1ec3fe-8c5 target_portal': 11.0.0.8:3260, volume_id': 8b1ec3fe-8c57-45ca-a1cf-a481bfc8fce2, target_lun': 1, access_mode': rw, auth_username': nE9PY8juynmmZ95F7Xb7, auth_method': CHAP}}`` In the process of building this data structure, the Cinder Volume Manager makes a number of calls to the backend driver, and builds a volume_attachment entry in the database to store the connection information passed in via the connector object. driver.validate_connector ************************* Simply verifies that the initiator data is included in the passed in connector (there are some drivers that utilize pieces of this connector data, but in the case of the reference, it just verifies it's there). driver.create_export ******************** This is the target specific, persistent data associated with a volume. This method is responsible for building an actual iSCSI target, and providing the "location" and "auth" information which will be used to form the response data in the parent request. We call this infor the model_update and it's used to update vital target information associated with the volume in the Cinder database. driver.intialize_connection *************************** Now that we've actually built a target and persisted the important bits of information associated with it, we're ready to actually assign the target to a volume and form the needed info to pass back out to our caller. This is where we finally put everything together and form the example data structure response shown earlier. This method is sort of deceptive, it does a whole lot of formatting of the data we've put together in the create_export call, but it doesn't really offer any new info. It's completely dependent on the information that was gathered in the create_export call and put into the database. At this point, all we're doing is taking all the various entries from the database and putting it together into the desired format/structure. The key method call for updating and obtaining all of this info was done by the create_export call. This formatted data is then passed back up to the API and returned as the response back out to Nova. At this point, we return attach info to the caller that provides everything needed to make the remote iSCSI connection. attach(self, context, volume, instance_uuid, host_name, mount_point, mode) -------------------------------------------------------------------------- This is the last call that *should* be pretty simple. The intent is that this is simply used to finalize the attach process. In other words, we simply update the status on the Volume in the database, and provide a mechanism to notify the driver that the attachment has completed succesfully. There's some additional information that has been added to this finalize call over time ike instance_uuid, host_name etc. Some of these are only provided during the actual attach call and may be desired for some drivers for one reason or another. Detach workflow =============== begin_detaching(self, context, volume) -------------------------------------- Analagous to the Attach workflows ``reserve_volume`` method. Performs a simple conditional update of Volume status to ``detaching``. terminate_connection(self, context, volume, connector, force=False) ------------------------------------------------------------------- Analagous to the Attach workflows ``initialize_connection`` method. Used to send calls down to drivers/target-drivers to do any sort of cleanup they might require. For most this is a noop, as connections and **iscsi session management is the responsibility of the initiator**. HOWEVER, there are a number of special cases here, particularly for target-drivers like LIO that use access-groups, in those cases they remove the initiator from the access list during this call which effectively closes sessions from the target side. detach(self, context, volume, attachment_id) ------------------------------------------------------------------- The final update to the DB and yet another opportunity to pass something down to the volume-driver. Initially a simple call-back that now has quite a bit of cruft built up in the volume-manager. For drivers like LVM this again is a noop and just updates the db entry to mark things as complete and set the volume to available again.

revisions:

commit_message:
Add extension requirement in port-security api test

if port-security extension is not enabled in neutron, 2 tests run and fail.
Even if port-security is not part of the tempest.conf api_extensions list.

Change-Id: I7c15bff96ea976841400e8df93d0c1cb74049bce
Closes-bug: #1542892
(cherry picked from commit f846519e5af6efa5007896c7ac75d13b415c3f53)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/47/283047/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test.requires_ext(extension='port-security', service='network')

subject: Update pool on pool create if it exists
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-13 09:33:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-zaqarclient/commit/d764668b5911c595a14bccaed5ade32c9f6e361d', 'message': 'Resolve asymmetric behaviour of zaqar client

As of now on PUT, zaqar server updates pool if
it is already exists else it will create a new one.
However zaqar client return previous pool info if
it is already exists. This result to a confusion for
operator.

The zaqar client should maitain symmetry with zaqar server.

commit_message:
Update pool on pool create if it exists

As of now on PUT, zaqar server updates pool if
it is already exists else it will create a new one.
However zaqar client return previous pool info if
it is already exists. This result to a confusion for
operator.

The zaqar client should maitain symmetry with zaqar server.

Change-Id: I0e7311321630c3f931cf27b0828394589eaf7320
Partial-Bug: #1532776

Add associate and disassociate floating IP actions

This adds the load balancer actions for associating and
disassociating a floating IP address.

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-lbaas-v2-ui

commit_message:
Add py34 to tox envlist

We are going to support python3.4, it's better to add py34 to the
envlist so that devs can fix python3 compatible issues.

Change-Id: I8b478f78c5fd2fb11e6fdcb02bffb10929113a18

commit_message:
Add vexxhost to nodepool with max servers 1

This is the initial change to start using vexxhost with nodepool. Start
with a max servers of 1 so that we can sort out any problems at small
scale and we can grow from here.

Change-Id: I3cd44b72f2eeb81e79242124b5559983f3eeaa48

commit_message:
Drop MANIFEST.in

It's not needed with PBR

As you can see setup.py:
setuptools.setup(
    setup_requires=['pbr>=1.8'],
    pbr=True)

So we no longer need MANIFEST.in.

Change-Id: Iadcdae8b796c0ba62a6299a6442ec92e7ed6cc2b

commit_message:
Optimize the registry claim function

The previous implementation was buggy. It was returning all registry
entries no matter they belong to dead engines or not. This patch
optimizes the implementation also revised the test cases.

Change-Id: I1f338fe99171de65600c567003afe4d2cc71122c

commit_message:
Add tests for RPC methods/classes

The public methods and classes within the neutron.common.rpc module are
untested. This adds tests for all public-facing functions within the
module.

Closes-Bug: #1535327
Change-Id: I80227dd73e58f8b5dbde9cea01ceac22cc8b2e34
(cherry picked from commit e4f2fb9df652354157c076bdf9b3eff464dcd3ba)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/79/285379/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import copy import fixturesimport oslo_messaging as messagingfrom neutron import contextclass RPCFixture(fixtures.Fixture): def _setUp(self): self.trans = copy.copy(rpc.TRANSPORT) self.noti = copy.copy(rpc.NOTIFIER) self.all_mods = copy.copy(rpc.ALLOWED_EXMODS) self.ext_mods = copy.copy(rpc.EXTRA_EXMODS) self.addCleanup(self._reset_everything) def _reset_everything(self): rpc.TRANSPORT = self.trans rpc.NOTIFIER = self.noti rpc.ALLOWED_EXMODS = self.all_mods rpc.EXTRA_EXMODS = self.ext_mods class TestRPC(base.DietTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestRPC, self).setUp() self.useFixture(RPCFixture()) @mock.patch.object(rpc, 'get_allowed_exmods') @mock.patch.object(rpc, 'RequestContextSerializer') @mock.patch.object(messaging, 'get_transport') @mock.patch.object(messaging, 'Notifier') def test_init(self, mock_not, mock_trans, mock_ser, mock_exmods): notifier = mock.Mock() transport = mock.Mock() serializer = mock.Mock() conf = mock.Mock() mock_exmods.return_value = ['foo'] mock_trans.return_value = transport mock_ser.return_value = serializer mock_not.return_value = notifier rpc.init(conf) mock_exmods.assert_called_once_with() mock_trans.assert_called_once_with(conf, allowed_remote_exmods=['foo'], aliases=rpc.TRANSPORT_ALIASES) mock_not.assert_called_once_with(transport, serializer=serializer) self.assertIsNotNone(rpc.TRANSPORT) self.assertIsNotNone(rpc.NOTIFIER) def test_cleanup_transport_null(self): rpc.NOTIFIER = mock.Mock() self.assertRaises(AssertionError, rpc.cleanup) def test_cleanup_notifier_null(self): rpc.TRANSPORT = mock.Mock() self.assertRaises(AssertionError, rpc.cleanup) def test_cleanup(self): rpc.NOTIFIER = mock.Mock() rpc.TRANSPORT = mock.Mock() trans_cleanup = mock.Mock() rpc.TRANSPORT.cleanup = trans_cleanup rpc.cleanup() trans_cleanup.assert_called_once_with() self.assertIsNone(rpc.TRANSPORT) self.assertIsNone(rpc.NOTIFIER) def test_add_extra_exmods(self): rpc.EXTRA_EXMODS = [] rpc.add_extra_exmods('foo', 'bar') self.assertEqual(['foo', 'bar'], rpc.EXTRA_EXMODS) def test_clear_extra_exmods(self): rpc.EXTRA_EXMODS = ['foo', 'bar'] rpc.clear_extra_exmods() self.assertEqual(0, len(rpc.EXTRA_EXMODS)) def test_get_allowed_exmods(self): rpc.ALLOWED_EXMODS = ['foo'] rpc.EXTRA_EXMODS = ['bar'] exmods = rpc.get_allowed_exmods() self.assertEqual(['foo', 'bar'], exmods) @mock.patch.object(rpc, 'RequestContextSerializer') @mock.patch.object(messaging, 'RPCClient') def test_get_client(self, mock_client, mock_ser): rpc.TRANSPORT = mock.Mock() tgt = mock.Mock() ser = mock.Mock() mock_client.return_value = 'client' mock_ser.return_value = ser client = rpc.get_client(tgt, version_cap='1.0', serializer='foo') commit_message:
Use slurp to collect the repo_server ssh keys

Extracting the ssh public key using cat and storing the result in a
fact has resulted in periodic failures in the collection of the key,
and thereafter the failure to appropriately place that key into the
authorised_keys file.

This patch changes the collection method to use the Ansible slurp
module which has been found to be more reliable.

Change-Id: I68699e7b59630cc3bc6113285edcb1ab936160ce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-repo_server refs/changes/42/286042/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: slurp: src: "{{ repo_service_home_folder }}/.ssh/id_rsa.pub" repo_pubkey: "{{ repo_pub.content }}"

suggested [2].

[1]. https://docs.python.org/2/library/functions.html#hasattr
     https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#hasattr
[2]. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/285647/

commit_message:
Use obj_attr_is_set to check whether an attr is set in oslo_versionedobject

hasattr() have different behaviour between python 2 and 3 [1], while we can
not fix oslo_versionedobject [2], we need to use obj_attr_is_set to
check whether an attr is set in oslo.versionedobject as their core
suggested [2].

[1]. https://docs.python.org/2/library/functions.html#hasattr
     https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#hasattr
[2]. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/285647/

More detailed info, please refer to the launchpad bug page.

Change-Id: I9adbbb55e8560a499e8334e954cc904fb8ee3565
Closes-Bug: #1551394
Partially-Implements: blueprint magnum-python3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/54/286654/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if self.obj_attr_is_set(k)}

commit_message:
Removed sshd_config file

This file is an oversight and should not be here. The file is adding the
option "UseDNS no" to the base config and while this is an option that
could be set, this is not something that this role needs or should be
doing.  This issue was pointed out in the course of Bug: #1549379 being
worked on.

Change-Id: I4c184b0967d67e431b5b4e33172522c49459a3eb
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-repo_server refs/changes/10/284410/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
"group" word should be used instead "pool"

Currently, when creating a new flavor, here
it need to set pool group name for the first
argument "pool".
For making clear between a pool and pool group,
So we should replace "pool" word with "pool_group"
at all the places.

According the discussion in IRC, for giving users time
to mirgate, we will support 'pool' and 'pool_group'
both in M, and will remove 'pool' in N.

APIImpact

Change-Id: Id4c976a1fc9cc7fb9b72482b4e3a7f7f80f94492
Closes-Bug: #1504959
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/31/273931/18 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pool_group=data['pool_group'], except errors.PoolDoesNotExistInGroup as ex: u'Pool does not exist in group %(pool_group)s') % dict(flavor=flavor, pool_group=data['pool_group']))
deleted_lines: pool=data['pool'], except errors.PoolDoesNotExist as ex: u'Pool %(pool)s does not exist') % dict(flavor=flavor, pool=data['pool']))

commit_message:
Make security-group-rule-create accept "any" protocol

Currently, all protocols are allowed only when user do not
specified the protocol. This change makes security-group-rule-create
accept protocol "any" to allow user explictly specify 'any' protocol,
and keep behavior consistent with FWaaS CLI and outputs of
"neutron security-group-rule-list".

Closes-Bug: #1470051
Closes-Bug: #1469642

Change-Id: I14a31458f5c97aea356c7afe083e13fd6f79c2df
