commit_message:
Python table is returning invalid template name

The data_table is looking for a template that doesn't exist. This
has been fixed.

partial-bug: #1544990
Closes-bug: #1531982

Change-Id: Id0c16aa26f18461a807166af2c5b347a130d72a8

commit_message:
To tag all the Admin-only APIs as Admin only

Currently, issuing manila help command, lists all APIs.
Therefore, there is no way to identify which is admin-only
and which is not. Fixed by tagging the admin-only api
as (Admin only) in help text.

Change-Id: I0f676901675b8d57e16c4275c5b579fcfa0ca2ae
Closes-Bug: #1457155

commit_message:
Remove aggressive assert from share server test

The delete_share_server test has an assert which can
fail in case of retries and give a false negative result.
This assert isn't necessary to check for correctness, so
remove it.

Closes-bug: 1546618

Change-Id: Ib04afdc222e19725df4da0793c1ffcc15282a772

subject: "fix sshpool.remove code"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-27 21:51:54.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/ssh_utils.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_ssh_utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/cb64d70d0f5e07738e964374d70d629c3b48042f', 'message': '"fix sshpool.remove code"

currently, sshpool.remove function under cinder/ssh_utils.py
is broken.

The function tries to locate the passed in sshclient object inside
sshpool.free_items.
However, since the sshclient object is set to none at the beginning,
it never finds the object and ends up with decrementing the current
size, without actually removing the object.

Made the following changes to fix:
1. Removed reset to None so that the attempt to locate object goes
through.
2. fixed the code to use free_items.remove(ssh) to remove the ssh
object identified instead of free_items.pop(sh)
3. also updated the code to decrement current size only if a match is
found in free_items.
4. Added test case to test remove() of an ssh client that is in the
free_items
5. Added test case to test that remove code does not inadvertently
remove an object from the pool if no match is found.

Change-Id: Ic5bf5b432453361c9059e57a7b489a0ee3fd726e
Closes-Bug: 1463557
'}]
commit_message:
"fix sshpool.remove code"

currently, sshpool.remove function under cinder/ssh_utils.py
is broken.

The function tries to locate the passed in sshclient object inside
sshpool.free_items.
However, since the sshclient object is set to none at the beginning,
it never finds the object and ends up with decrementing the current
size, without actually removing the object.

Made the following changes to fix:
1. Removed reset to None so that the attempt to locate object goes
through.
2. fixed the code to use free_items.remove(ssh) to remove the ssh
object identified instead of free_items.pop(sh)
3. also updated the code to decrement current size only if a match is
found in free_items.
4. Added test case to test remove() of an ssh client that is in the
free_items
5. Added test case to test that remove code does not inadvertently
remove an object from the pool if no match is found.

Change-Id: Ic5bf5b432453361c9059e57a7b489a0ee3fd726e
Closes-Bug: 1463557
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/42/285742/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import paramiko import random import uuid def test_sshpool_remove(self, mock_isfile, mock_sshclient, mock_open, mock_conf): mock_sshclient.return_value = FakeSSHClient() mock_conf.ssh_hosts_key_file.return_value = 'dummy' sshpool = ssh_utils.SSHPool("127.0.0.1", 22, 10, "test", password="test", min_size=1, max_size=4) sshpool.put(FakeSSHClient()) sshpool.put(FakeSSHClient()) ssh1 = sshpool.free_items[random.choice([0, 1, 2])] mylist = list(sshpool.free_items) self.assertIn(ssh1, mylist) ssh1.get_transport().active = False sshpool.remove(ssh1) mylist = list(sshpool.free_items) self.assertNotIn(ssh1, mylist) @mock.patch('cinder.ssh_utils.CONF') @mock.patch('six.moves.builtins.open') @mock.patch('paramiko.SSHClient') @mock.patch('os.path.isfile', return_value=True) def test_sshpool_remove_object_not_in_pool(self, mock_isfile, mock_sshclient, mock_open, mock_conf): mock_sshclient.return_value = FakeSSHClient() mock_conf.ssh_hosts_key_file.return_value = 'dummy' sshpool = ssh_utils.SSHPool("127.0.0.1", 22, 10, "test", password="test", min_size=1, max_size=4) sshpool.put(FakeSSHClient()) sshpool.put(FakeSSHClient()) ssh1 = FakeSSHClient() listBefore = list(sshpool.free_items) self.assertNotIn(ssh1, listBefore) listAfter = list(sshpool.free_items) self.assertEqual(listBefore, listAfter) @mock.patch('cinder.ssh_utils.CONF') @mock.patch('six.moves.builtins.open') @mock.patch('paramiko.SSHClient') @mock.patch('os.path.isfile', return_value=True)

commit_message:
remove containers on delete

This patch calls client.remove_container after a container has stopped
running in response to client.kill.

In the event that a container is created with an explict name, as in:

  docker_dbserver:
    type: "DockerInc::Docker::Container"
    properties:
      image: mysql
      name: dbserver

Failure to remove the container on delete will prevent the stack from being
re-deployed.

Change-Id: Ic864d1a808b303fcb58815b87e55a0e7d1639bbb
closes-bug: #1364019

commit_message:
Allow str_replace to reference parameters/attributes

Currently a validation error occurs if you attempt to reference
via get_param or get_attr when using str_replace, however if
we avoid the explicit validation in the constructor it actually
works fine, and we already have a validation to handle any
invalid input elsewhere in the function definition.

This is a combination of two commits,
0d109b75d9a0d6e043bd8f513943d3d107050483 and
0b8d03a840c3070f3ffecd093adff6a7f1a02c33 - the latter fixed
some issues with the initial patch and test.

Closes-Bug: #1539737
(cherry picked from commit 0d109b75d9a0d6e043bd8f513943d3d107050483
and commit 0b8d03a840c3070f3ffecd093adff6a7f1a02c33)
Change-Id: Ib934f443a8b8e4f75335a9d8b992e7f86791aa45

added_lines: def test_str_replace_ref_get_param(self): """Test str_replace referencing parameters.""" hot_tpl = template_format.parse(''' heat_template_version: 2015-04-30 parameters: p_template: type: string default: foo-replaceme p_params: type: json default: replaceme: success resources: rsrc: type: ResWithStringPropAndAttr properties: a_string: str_replace: template: {get_param: p_template} params: {get_param: p_params} outputs: replaced: value: {get_attr: [rsrc, string]} ''') tmpl = template.Template(hot_tpl) self.stack = parser.Stack(utils.dummy_context(), 'test_stack', tmpl) self.stack.store() self.stack.create() self.assertEqual((parser.Stack.CREATE, parser.Stack.COMPLETE), self.stack.state) self.assertEqual('foo-success', self.stack.output('replaced'))

commit_message:
Map RequestLimitExceeded exception in heat-cfn-api

The heat-cfn-api wasn't handling the RequestLimitExceeded error.
Instead it returned generic "Internal Server Error". The fix is to
correctly map RequestLimitedExceeded exception in heat-cfn-api.
Added unit test to verify mapping of RequestLimitExceeded error.

Change-Id: I6e13b2f6b1458fb7c194632db67eb2cebdb173d2
Closes-Bug: #1542559

commit_message:
Add missing os types: suseGuest64/suseGuest

According to http://pubs.vmware.com/vsphere-60/index.jsp,
vsphere os types in openstack lack suseGuest64/suseGuest.
Closes-Bug: #1545999

Change-Id: I46973077c3214fec5766a85823f4ca9931df2708

commit_message:
NUMATopologyFilter raise exception and not continue filter next node

NUMATopologyFilter raise exception and not continue filter next node
when there is no wanted pagesize in current filtered host.

Catch MemoryPageSizeNotSupported exception to prevent this exception
suspend procedure of filter hosts.

Change-Id: Ice092c871beeca5de2fa6bbf274240f4db508008
Closes-Bug: 1473308

commit_message:
Fix jitter strategies

Seems like the wrong function signature was being decorated
so this fixes that and adds an initial test to make sure it
continues to work as expected.

Also fixes the invalid usage of random in the jitter
decorator.

Change-Id: If30fcc1430b84078dc5fc104aa28f06471e4c358

added_lines: def test_last_finished_strategy_jitter(self): ev = self.event_cls() calls = [] stop_after_calls = 3 @periodics.periodic(0.1, run_immediately=False) def fast_periodic(): calls.append(True) if len(calls) > stop_after_calls: ev.set() worker_kwargs = self.worker_kwargs.copy() worker_kwargs['schedule_strategy'] = 'last_finished_jitter' callables = [ (fast_periodic, None, None), ] w = periodics.PeriodicWorker(callables, **worker_kwargs) with self.create_destroy(w.start): ev.wait() w.stop()

commit_message:
Fix NetApp cDOT driver update_access negative test

A negative internal Tempest test somehow didn't catch a problem
with the recent update_access patch. If a flexvol is deleted on
cDOT without Manila's knowledge, deleting the corresponding Manila
share should still succeed. The core update_access changes call
update_access during a share delete workflow to remove all the
existing rules, and that path in the cDOT driver needs to be
hardened against the cases where either share or share server
no longer exist.  Also, fix a mis-named lock object in the same
code path.

Change-Id: Ibb88c64ddd899c09cd148f398e21ac613be9f15b
Closes-Bug: #1549518

commit_message:
Ensure to_dict() supports unicode

When we compose a string for user_identity, we should
ensure that we don't break for non-ascii strings in
user name or tenant name or domain names.

Change-Id: Id457ebe415f78c435fc8ece810f0a1b20964dabf
Closes-Bug: #1507937

commit_message:
Ignore TypeErrors on old properties during update

Extend the approach from 1cfde62b2ff8a60c8cc3a9ef4926e5f4a7116aee of
ignoring ValueErrors in the _previous_ properties when doing an update to
also ignoring TypeErrors.

Change-Id: Ic08165fe031e1764cfb34eaf782d3e105f04fee3
Closes-Bug: #1538551
Related-Bug: #1543685

commit_message:
Get region_name that volume_driver rexray region_name needs

Config volume_driver rexray need region_name

The patch gets region_name, validates the region_name and add
Unit test.
Co-Authored By: Kai Qiang Wu(Kennan)<wkqwu@cn.ibm.com>
Co-Authored By: Ton Ngo<ton@us.ibm.com>
Partially-Implements: blueprint magnum-integrate-with-cinder
Change-Id: I3fcef0ffb7cda162fffcbedf4628cad81168d09d

added_lines: def test_get_regionname(self, mock_ks): key = 'region_name' val = 'RegionOne' cfg.CONF.set_override(key, val, 'rexray') mock_service = mock.MagicMock() mock_service.name = 'keystone' mock_service.id = '111' mock_ks.return_value.services.list.return_value = [mock_service] mock_endpoint = mock.MagicMock() mock_endpoint.region = 'RegionOne' mock_endpoint.interface = 'public' mock_endpoint.service_id = '111' mock_ks.return_value.endpoints.list.return_value = [mock_endpoint] ks_client = keystone.KeystoneClientV3(self.ctx) region_name = ks_client.get_regionname() self.assertEqual('RegionOne', region_name) def test_get_regionname_not_found(self, mock_ks): key = 'region_name' val = 'region123' cfg.CONF.set_override(key, val, 'rexray') ks_client = keystone.KeystoneClientV3(self.ctx) self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidParameterValue, ks_client.get_regionname) def test_get_regionname_is_None(self, mock_ks): key = 'region_name' val = None cfg.CONF.set_override(key, val, 'rexray') ks_client = keystone.KeystoneClientV3(self.ctx) self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidParameterValue, ks_client.get_regionname)

commit_message:
Service driver support in L2gw for south bound

The patch set provides a framework to support
service drivers so that the south bound implementation
need not be tied to only the L2gw agent communicating
over the RabbitMQ message bus. This will help to support
other types of south bound implementations like OpenDaylight.

Change-Id: I403c7c0f110d4ad95d803640508b78c1539d181f
Closes-Bug: 1478812
Author: Maruti  <maruti.kamat@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Manjunath Patil <mpatil@hp.com>

commit_message:
Fix some wrong strings in ko_KR docs index page

1. '' must have a space between '' and ''
2. <sting> -> '<strong>'
3. A meaningless grave accent exists
4. elaborate an ambiguous expression more concisely
5. remove a period which is not used in the base document
6. '' has to have a space between '' and ''

As index page is like a face of this project, any trivial spelling error
cannot be allowed.

Change-Id: Ie769e23bce348ddbe7c233a59c82fe7c51748057

commit_message:
adding missed parameter in function signature

ovsdb_identifier parameter is missing while calling
delete_logical_switch and insert_ucast_macs_remote
function when enable_manager flag is set to False.

Closes-Bug:1546132

Change-Id: I93869f240a9000c7e0298e7ce7a8ec343b6d0982

commit_message:
Replace deprecating oslo_utils.timeutils functions

This change introduces manila.common.timeutils that substitutes
the deprecating functions from oslo_utils. The deprecation
happens in this commit.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/252898/

Change-Id: Ic665be3eef1bffe0a27f8a7c334f18daf9c30dfc
Closes-Bug: #1527486

commit_message:
Update IPv6 PD guide for new subnetpools behaviour

Changes to the default subnetpools mechanism require the user
to pass '--use_default_subnetpool' when creating a subnet that
should use the default.

Change-Id: I31fb80c9c1bc419e95988e53ff6b115312706f22
Depends-On: Ifff57c0485e4727f352b2cc2bd1bdaabd0f1606b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/82/284982/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --ipv6_ra_mode slaac --ipv6_address_mode slaac --use_default_subnetpool

commit_message:
[Install Guide] Update SUSE versions

Update for openSUSE Leap 42.1 and SLES 12 SP1. Adjust OpenStack link to
use new Mitaka repositories.
Remove extra version information.
Update gpg key.

Also, update title for draft-index.

Change-Id: I68e67c269f4c7bfb584d75b3884ebe3cd20eb071
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/84/286484/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: **On openSUSE Leap 42.1:** # zypper addrepo -f obs://Cloud:OpenStack:Mitaka/openSUSE_Leap_42.1 Mitaka **On SLES 12 SP1:** # zypper addrepo -f obs://Cloud:OpenStack:Mitaka/SLE_12_SP1 Mitaka
deleted_lines: **On openSUSE 13.2:** # zypper addrepo -f obs://Cloud:OpenStack:Liberty/openSUSE_13.2 Liberty **On SLES 12:** # zypper addrepo -f obs://Cloud:OpenStack:Liberty/SLE_12 Liberty

commit_message:
Raise AttributeError instead of NotImplementedError

hasattr() will use object's getter to determine if a attr exists.
In python3, only AttributeError is checked:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#hasattr
If we raise other exception like NotImplementedError, the program
will exit due to the exception.

In python2, any exception is ok, so change to AttributeError will
make no regressions on python2.7.
https://docs.python.org/2/library/functions.html#hasattr

Magnum uses oslo_versionedobjects as it's base object, and it will
rely on the hasattr() to generate object attr dict. Before this patch
we got error when trying to generate object dict on python34 test:
'    _("Cannot load \'%s\' in the base class") % attrname)'
"NotImplementedError: Cannot load 'id' in the base class
http://logs.openstack.org/93/285693/3/check/gate-magnum-python34/960581a/console.html
Tha patch fix the problem.

Closes-Bug: #1551394
Partially-Implements: blueprint magnum-python3
Change-Id: I0ce4132bbd80e71e8ba34a0e4da806c98892f828

commit_message:
Simple soft deletion clean up for barbican-db-manage

Adds a simple 'clean' command to barbican-db-manage to
clean up valid soft deletes in the database. It
also includes unit tests which includes
throwing a sql integrity error.

The unit tests did not support foreign key constraints.
database_utils.py and test_certificate_resources.py were
changed to support foreign key constraints during sqllite
testing.

This is the first CR for cleaning up soft deletes in the database.
The list of CRs will be:
1) Simple soft deletion clean up for barbican-db-manage
2) Make clean up script configurable and create documentation

Change-Id: Ida9507e5c2378ca7ad1e9dbbe5a99b627584a7f8
Partially-implements: blueprint clean-db-soft-deletes

commit_message:
Rebase on deprecated VIOS.xags

Recent pypowervm change 4718b37cb78d188acc9d61245663ceb0e16a2f4d
deprecated pypowervm.wrappers.virtual_io_server.VIOS.xags.  This change
set rebases to use the new recommended consts from the
pypowervm.const.XAG enum.

Change-Id: Ib1cf890a38154b3391a0f543543ce030498849f6

commit_message:
Remove unused pngmath Sphinx extension

There's no RST file that uses ".. math" and thus
the pngmath Sphinx extension is not used and can
get removed.

Change-Id: I3ea4b529025c8ac3c4092f3720124647861e6668

commit_message:
Stop using Hidden property for RandomString

Sequence property was hidden. According to translation rule it now
changed on self.CHARACTER_CLASSES_CLASS property.
As result code in validation and handle_create methods can be removed.
Also unittests was changed to demostrate changes applied for Hidden
property.

Class with TestGenerateRandomString was changed to use new algorithm for
generation random strings.

Change-Id: I3f81df94b24e0f751d2070dc314f15ceb95164ce

commit_message:
Cells: Call compute api methods with instance objects

When nova-cells processes a 'run_compute_api_method' message it pulls
the instance from the local db and calls the appropriate compute api
method with a sqlalchemy model.  Instead it should populate an instance
object and pass that in.

Change-Id: Ib4fb46310c2a2c1edf378ed3a3fd42421ff4cb47
Closes-bug: #1290975
(cherry picked from commit ca908166dbfc311715e9e10449eb5e93add66a30)

commit_message:
VMware: Prefer ShutdownGuest to PowerOffVM_Task

PowerOffVM_Task is a dangerous operation, while ShutdownGuest is
more secure. so we use ShutdownGuest instead of PowerOffVM_Task,
if vmtools has been installed.

The patch was originally proposed by "javeme <javaloveme@gmail.com>" in
I61f36c93e0e14a2d98feb9d24cc969081c4d8b14. This is an updated version to
work with the current code base.

Change-Id: I866aa2bcf0ba7d8976de33b19796a52f53068c7f
Closes-Bug: #1445858

commit_message:
Add groups in scoped federated tokens

Groups should be added also to project/domain federated tokens.
Rationale behind this is that federated token is an 'identity' of the
ephemeral user and there is no other way to retrieve required
information rather then directly from the token.

We also do a simple refactoring for a better readibility:

dict[x] = obj is used instead of dict.update({a:b})

Conflicts:
	keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_federation.py
	keystone/token/providers/common.py

Closes-Bug: 1541657

(cherry picked from commit 31a2f67de4b26ea9e193d94c2cdfddb91afb8098)

Change-Id: I0b11d93836e5737d4d8fdfb5ec0351072eae7329

commit_message:
Add some documentation on authoring plugins

There's been some feedback that it would be useful to have an
explanation of why certain things are the way they are in plugins. This
is intended as a start at documentation outlining how plugins are
structured and what functionality they must implement.

Change-Id: If517ffc421ac361fe833285625bedb447d000f98

commit_message:
Migrations squash

SQL Migrations for Liberty require the schema version to be at 055
which is the final verison for the Juno release. This limits the
change sets that could affect assumptions made in earlier migration
files.

Change-Id: I693f5808306660b37ce2a22f2a5d1dda14cfdbc3
Implements: blueprint liberty-sql-squash

commit_message:
Add sql.conflicts decorator for update_endpoint

The function which is update_endpoint need to resolve conflicts,
so a sql.conflicts decorator was added.
Change-Id: Ibbc0442787e9996c09764b768f8d303d8d926188

commit_message:
Fix the migration issue for the user doesn't have a password

If user doesn't have a password, the migration 091 will fail, this is
because the `password` table doesn't allow the `password`
field to be null.

There is no need to insert an empty entry into `password`
table. The user not reference with any `password` instance will imply
the `user` doesn't have a password.

This patch also fixes the case that the user from `user` table already
exists in `local_user` table and result in `DBDuplicateEntry` exception
due to the bug #1549705.

Change-Id: I4db73ee673573ab63b36bf092c17f8ba64605939
Closes-Bug: #1549705
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/52/285152/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_migrate_user_with_null_password_to_password_tables(self): USER_TABLE_NAME = 'user' LOCAL_USER_TABLE_NAME = 'local_user' PASSWORD_TABLE_NAME = 'password' self.upgrade(90) # only mandatory fields is given. user_ref = {'id': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'domain_id': uuid.uuid4().hex} session = self.Session() self.insert_dict(session, USER_TABLE_NAME, user_ref) self.upgrade(91) # migration should be successful. self.assertTableCountsMatch(USER_TABLE_NAME, LOCAL_USER_TABLE_NAME) # no new entry added in the password table since the user created # doesn't set with a password. try: table1 = self.select_table(PASSWORD_TABLE_NAME) except sqlalchemy.exc.NoSuchTableError: raise AssertionError('Table "%s" does not exist' % PASSWORD_TABLE_NAME) rows = session.execute(table1).count() self.assertEqual(0, rows)

subject: Fixes issue testing with oslo_policy.Enforcer
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-30 00:29:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/e0384e9bc35657ab543813c4924c2fb0618b7af9', 'message': "Umm...yeah. If this works I'll make a better msg

The tests were originally calling keystone.policy.backends.rules:init to
register the oslo_policy options and create the Enforcer intance. We
can't do this because this doesn't give our tests classes the
opportunity to override CONF.oslo_policy.policy_file because the
Enforcer was created at import time.

Instead we'll register the olso_policy options so that we can override
them and let the rule.init() be called at runtime *after* our setUp code
runs.

Change-Id: I5e1129249482361de9ecb3d37e20d149c9558901
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-30 02:06:36.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/core.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/5945b786f7dea9240644e0185865d1c875457167', 'message': "Fixes issue testing with oslo_policy.Enforcer

The tests were originally calling keystone.policy.backends.rules:init to
register the oslo_policy options and create the Enforcer instance. We
can't do this because this doesn't give our tests classes the
opportunity to override CONF.oslo_policy.policy_file because the
Enforcer was created at import time.

Instead we'll register the olso_policy options so that we can override
them and let the rule.init() be called at runtime *after* our setUp code
runs.

Change-Id: I5e1129249482361de9ecb3d37e20d149c9558901
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes issue testing with oslo_policy.Enforcer

The tests were originally calling keystone.policy.backends.rules:init to
register the oslo_policy options and create the Enforcer instance. We
can't do this because this doesn't give our tests classes the
opportunity to override CONF.oslo_policy.policy_file because the
Enforcer was created at import time.

Instead we'll register the olso_policy options so that we can override
them and let the rule.init() be called at runtime *after* our setUp code
runs.

Change-Id: I5e1129249482361de9ecb3d37e20d149c9558901

commit_message:
Add policy support to workflow steps

This updates the workflow decorator service to check policy rules to
determine whether or not to display a workflow step. Each workflow
step can have a policy property which specifies the policy rule to
check.

Related to blueprint add-scheduler-hints
Change-Id: Id9270a4f20d785283372c182d178fe9b59e3259b

beforeEach(inject(function($injector) { $scope = $injector.get('$rootScope').$new(); deferred = $injector.get('$q').defer(); decoratorService = $injector.get('horizon.app.core.workflow.decorator'); catalogService = $injector.get('horizon.app.core.openstack-service-api.serviceCatalog'); policyService = $injector.get('horizon.app.core.openstack-service-api.policy'); spyOn(catalogService, 'ifTypeEnabled').and.returnValue(deferred.promise); spyOn(policyService, 'ifAllowed').and.returnValue(deferred.promise); })); it('is a function', function() { expect(angular.isFunction(decoratorService)).toBe(true); }); it('checks each step for required services and policies', function() { decoratorService(spec); expect(steps[0].checkReadiness).toBeUndefined(); expect(steps[1].checkReadiness).toBeDefined(); expect(steps[2].checkReadiness).toBeDefined(); expect(catalogService.ifTypeEnabled.calls.count()).toBe(1); expect(catalogService.ifTypeEnabled).toHaveBeenCalledWith('foo-service'); expect(policyService.ifAllowed.calls.count()).toBe(1); expect(policyService.ifAllowed).toHaveBeenCalledWith('foo-policy'); }); it('step checkReadiness function returns correct results', function() { decoratorService(spec); var readinessResult; deferred.resolve('foo'); steps[1].checkReadiness().then(function(result) { readinessResult = result; }); $scope.$apply(); expect(readinessResult).toEqual(['foo']); }); }); })();

commit_message:
Add support for ECC signatures

Previously, only RSA-PSS signatures were supported for signature
verification in glance. This patch adds support for verifying
Elliptic Curve Cryptography signatures, including unit tests.

Change-Id: I2f01a2d12b1f35ed13caf0479a4f07add2773dff
Partial-Bug: #1513973

subject: Adds script that checks for etc/keystone.conf
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-08 22:26:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/59cc4af5e349cf4d8c41d884c801faf31e46eeb3', 'message': 'Updated ~/keystone/keystone/cmd/manage.py

Adds command that checks for keystone.conf when keystone-manage is ran.

If keystone.conf is not able to be read, whether from absense of permission or the file simply not existing, keystone-manage reports no problems, when in reality, no changes are made upon running commands such as db_sync. This fix adds a script that checks for the presense and ability to read/write the keystone.conf file. If it is not found, the user is prompted to either abort the command or to copy the ~/keystone/etc/keystone.conf.sample file to ~/keystone/etc/keystone.conf. This fix will prevent keystone-manage commands from seemingly executing correctly, but not having any effect.

In ~/keystone/keystone/cmd/manage.py, there is code to check for the ability to read/write the keystone.conf file. If the current user does not have rw permissions, the user is prompted to choose between aborting the command or copying the contents in keystone.conf.sample to keystone.conf. If the user chooses to copy keystone.conf.sample to keystone.conf and keystone.conf.sample cannot be found, the user is prompted to choose a new location of the keystone.conf.sample file. As well, the user can choose where to write the keystone.conf file to.

Change-Id: Ib78a611fde3b8e828d75b3124d4debdff3be5c21
Closes-Bug: #1273273

If it is not found, the user is prompted to either abort the command or to copy the ~/keystone/etc/keystone.conf.sample file to ~/keystone/etc/keystone.conf. In ~/keystone/keystone/cmd/manage.py, there is code to check for the ability to read/write the keystone.conf file. commit_message:
Adds script that checks for etc/keystone.conf

Whenthe user runskeystone-manage, thisscript checks for the presence
of ~/keystone/etc/keystone.conf. If it is not possible to read or write
the file (e.g., missing file or insufficient permissions), the user is
notified and prompted to either abort the process or copy the contents
from ~/keystone/etc/keystone.conf.sample
to ~/keystone/etc/keystone.conf.

Currently, if a user runs keystone_manage (db_sync,for example), and
either the user has insufficient permissions to read/write
keystone.conf or the file does not exist, the command would have no
effect, yet the user wouldnot be notified.
This patch would rectify this problem by notifying the user and giving
appropriate options

Change-Id: Ib78a611fde3b8e828d75b3124d4debdff3be5c21
Closes-Bug: #1273273i

commit_message:
Rearrange and cleanup tacker doc index

Rearrange tacker doc index for easier navigation and
access to installation steps. Introduce devstack
installation steps along with the manual installation
procedure.

Change-Id: I06cefdbcd34ff9db03196e908ecfd03c21d2407e
(cherry picked from commit cc52a9430e35068ed05d73eec656bcf2ce5ad393)

See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License. ==================== Install via Devstack ==================== If there is no preference, it is recommended to install Tacker from master branch. Install from master ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 1. Download DevStack:: $ git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack-dev/devstack $ cd devstack 2. Add this repo as an external repository into your ``local.conf`` file:: [[local|localrc]] enable_plugin tacker https://git.openstack.org/openstack/tacker 3. Run ``stack.sh``:: $ stack.sh Install from Liberty ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 1. Download DevStack liberty branch:: $ git clone -b stable/liberty https://git.openstack.org/openstack-dev/devstack $ cd devstack 2. Add this repo as an external repository into your ``local.conf`` file:: [[local|localrc]] enable_plugin tacker https://git.openstack.org/openstack/tacker stable/liberty 3. Run ``stack.sh``:: $ stack.sh

added_lines: import warnings from functools import wraps def deprecated(name): """This decorator can be used to mark a call as deprecated.""" def deprecate_it(func): def dep_func(*args, **kwargs): warnings.simplefilter('always', DeprecationWarning) warnings.warn("Call to %s deprecated, avoid its usage." % name, category=DeprecationWarning) return func(*args, **kwargs) return wraps(func)(dep_func) return deprecate_it

commit_message:
Improvements for rally jobs files.

This patch improves files related to Rally jobs.

Changes:
  * README.rst is updated
  * added directory `extra/' for custom files
  * added directory `plugins/' for custom Rally plugins

Change-Id: I3908a5743ed869af728e179ce96ff74a7926873e

commit_message:
Use partitions in all DSE2 tests

Change: Make every test that uses DSE2 create and use its own DSE2 partition.
Follows the example of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/283875/

Purpose: Isolate tests so that they do not interfere over the shared bus.
Resolve tox-new_arch failures.

Change-Id: If45150f4e6670f488d2285a517f5e28b3efc8181

commit_message:
Comparision of database models and migrations.

It's would be nice to be sure, that DB state is actually the
same as SQLA models description. This will allows us reduce SQLite
usage, generate initial DB schema from SQLA metadata (not from migrations),
simplify DB migrations, etc.
So, we shouldn't allow declaration of models and migrations with
differences. Furthermore we should take into account all the backends
implementation traits and achieve maximum models and migrations
conformity.

Co-Authored-By: Ilya Pekelny <ipekelny@mirantis.com>

Related-Bug: #1292591
Change-Id: I47444c4944f08535227718e368a1950c45c6cb32
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/30/80630/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2014 Mirantis.inc # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import importlib import itertools import pkgutil from keystone.common import sql from keystone.common.sql import migration_helpers from keystone import exception from keystone.openstack.common.db.sqlalchemy import migration from keystone.openstack.common.db.sqlalchemy import test_base from keystone.openstack.common.db.sqlalchemy import test_migrations class TestSyncModelsWithMigrations(test_base.DbTestCase, test_migrations.ModelsMigrationsSync): sql_modules_paths = set() sql_modules = [] def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): super(TestSyncModelsWithMigrations, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) self._loader() def _loader(self, loaders=None): """All the models should be initialized. Therefore all the modules which contains sqlalchemy models must be imported before the test will be runed. """ loaders = loaders or [pkgutil.get_importer('keystone'), ] level_next = list(itertools.chain( *[i.iter_modules(prefix=i.path + '/') for i in loaders])) self.sql_modules_paths |= set( map(lambda i: i[0].replace('/', '.'), filter(lambda x: x[0].endswith('/sql'), level_next)) ) next_loaders = [pkgutil.get_importer(i[0]) for i in level_next if i[1]] if next_loaders: return self._loader(next_loaders) for i in self.sql_modules_paths: self.sql_modules.append(importlib.import_module(i)) def db_sync(self, engine): """All migrations syunchronyzation.""" for i in self.sql_modules_paths: try: abs_path = migration_helpers.find_migrate_repo( importlib.import_module(i.replace('.backends.sql', '')) ) except exception.MigrationNotProvided: continue migration.db_version_control(engine, abs_path) migration.db_sync(engine, abs_path) def include_object(slef, object_, name, type_, reflected, compare_to): return name not in ['migrate_version', ] def get_engine(self): return self.engine def get_metadata(self): return sql.ModelBase.metadata

commit_message:
Updated venv build process for virtualenv compat

This changes the no-download flag to never-download which is
available in virtualenv <=14

Change-Id: Ibde57b33fb2341d0376b2aa01755817cd1a518ab
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-repo_build refs/changes/23/286923/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --never-download

commit_message:
Related-Bug: 1479569

Improved keystone server output by including the "name" attribute
for common entities: role, domain, user, project, group
produced by "role assignment list" command output.

Change-Id: I4d5726bfb77d4ef19ae94a8be1a6546c648d6a76
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/56/254456/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from keystone.assignment.role_backends.sql import RoleTablefrom keystone.identity.backends.sql import Group from keystone.identity.backends.sql import User from keystone.identity.mapping_backends.sql import IDMapping from keystone.resource.backends.sql import Domain from keystone.resource.backends.sql import Project ref = jref[0] role_name = jref[1] idmap = jref[2] domain_name = jref[3] project_name = jref[4] uname = jref[5] gname = jref[6] user_name = uname if uname else\ (idmap.local_id if idmap else "") group_name = gname if gname else\ (idmap.local_id if idmap else "") if user_name: assignment['user_name'] = user_name assignment['project_name'] = project_name if user_name: assignment['user_name'] = user_name assignment['domain_name'] = domain_name if group_name: assignment['group_name'] = group_name assignment['project_name'] = project_name if group_name: assignment['group_name'] = group_name assignment['domain_name'] = domain_name assignment['role_name'] = role_name query = session.query(RoleAssignment, RoleTable.name, IDMapping, Domain.name, Project.name, User.name, Group.name)\ .join(RoleTable, RoleTable.id == RoleAssignment.role_id)\ .outerjoin(IDMapping, IDMapping.public_id == RoleAssignment.actor_id)\ .outerjoin(Domain, RoleAssignment.target_id == Domain.id)\ .outerjoin(Project, RoleAssignment.target_id == Project.id)\ .outerjoin(User, IDMapping.local_id == User.id)\ .outerjoin(Group, IDMapping.local_id == Group.id)\

subject: Add libvirt-python to test-requirements.txt to enforce min version
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-15 21:08:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e72fe7b86e9347fbe6c336afc4198a22b2b3c9bb', 'message': "Add libvirt-python to test-requirements.txt to enforce min version

libvirt-python should not be used in the unit tests, fakelibvirt should
be used to avoid test differences depending on the version of
libvirt-python in tox.

However, libvirt-python is required if you're running nova-compute with
the libvirt driver so we should list libvirt-python in
test-requirements.txt as an optional dependency (like oslo.vmware for
the vmware driver).

With this we can pin the minimum required version to 1.2.5 which allows
us to also remove a workaround for libvirt-python < 1.1.2 for
baselineCPU().

Since the driver, host and firewall modules all import libvirt we make
sure the tests using those modules are overwriting their global libvirt
attribute with fakelibvirt for consistent test results.

Change-Id: I22fc334884a90f3331a3fa040e6a0c952f0d7306
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-10 21:21:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/4f606e2b74c18ef908685674bd7b6f74c69be12a', 'message': "Add libvirt-python to test-requirements.txt to enforce min version

libvirt-python should not be used in the unit tests, fakelibvirt should
be used to avoid test differences depending on the version of
libvirt-python in tox.

However, libvirt-python is required if you're running nova-compute with
the libvirt driver so we should list libvirt-python in

commit_message:
Add libvirt-python to test-requirements.txt to enforce min version

libvirt-python should not be used in the unit tests, fakelibvirt should
be used to avoid test differences depending on the version of
libvirt-python in tox.

However, libvirt-python is required if you're running nova-compute with
the libvirt driver so we should list libvirt-python in
test-requirements.txt as an optional dependency (like oslo.vmware for
the vmware driver).

With this we can pin the minimum required version to 1.2.5 which allows
us to also remove a workaround for libvirt-python < 1.1.2 for
baselineCPU().

Since the driver, host and firewall modules all import libvirt we make
sure the tests using those modules are overwriting their global libvirt
attribute with fakelibvirt for consistent test results.

Change-Id: I22fc334884a90f3331a3fa040e6a0c952f0d7306
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/06/183706/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Make sure libvirt-python does not creep into unit tests.firewall.libvirt = fakelibvirt

subject: Split instance resize operation into 2 phases
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-24 13:57:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/eb7bbb6ae2d750ad9c9231be25470b5e164d9b72', 'message': "Split instance resize operation into 2 phases

Resize operation call compute.manager. using cast
this doen't allow to notify user that there is something
goes wrong. For example attempt to resize instance down
fails silently. Traces were located only in nova-compute.log
resize operation now is splited into 2 parts:
Phase1: check that instance could be resized(sync rpc call).
Phase2: execute resize process(async over cast).

Closes-bug: #1455460

Change-Id: Ie814331b9ddaab2762282a45ba1cdc7065f7e157
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-24 15:29:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/4cb155cfe9eac697d1fc32a4f1bd34e2026a95d9', 'message': "Split instance resize operation into 2 phases

Resize operation call compute.manager. using cast
this doen't allow to notify user that there is something
goes wrong. For example attempt to resize instance down
fails silently. Traces were located only in nova-compute.log
resize operation now is splited into 2 parts:
Phase1: check that instance could be resized(sync rpc call).
Phase2: execute resize process(async over cast).

Closes-bug: #1455460

Change-Id: Ie814331b9ddaab2762282a45ba1cdc7065f7e157
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-06-25 12:51:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/a20a57b792728e05bac9b6f0f61e3f65a06aee34', 'message': "Split instance resize operation into 2 phases

Resize operation call compute.manager. Using cast
doesn't allow to notify user that something has
gone wrong. For example, an attempt to resize an instance down
fails silently. The error may only be found in the nova-compute
log file.

In order to return more useful error messages to the end user,
and to allow the operator to better diagnose failures, the resize
operation has been split into two parts. The first part checks
that the instance can indeed be resized, while the second part
performs the actual instance resize operation. The actual resize
operation is performed asynchronously, since the operation can
take a long time, however, the check operation is performed
synchronously, in order to provide better and quicker failure
conditions to the user.

Closes-bug: #1455460

Change-Id: Ie814331b9ddaab2762282a45ba1cdc7065f7e157

that the instance can indeed be resized, while the second part
performs the actual instance resize operation. The actual resize
operation is performed asynchronously, since the operation can
take a long time, however, the check operation is performed
synchronously, in order to provide better and quicker failure
conditions to the user.

Closes-bug: #1455460

Change-Id: Ie814331b9ddaab2762282a45ba1cdc7065f7e157
"}]
commit_message:
Split instance resize operation into 2 phases

Resize operation call compute.manager. Using cast
doesn't allow to notify user that something has
gone wrong. For example, an attempt to resize an instance down
fails silently. The error may only be found in the nova-compute
log file.

In order to return more useful error messages to the end user,
and to allow the operator to better diagnose failures, the resize
operation has been split into two parts. The first part checks
that the instance can indeed be resized, while the second part
performs the actual instance resize operation. The actual resize
operation is performed asynchronously, since the operation can
take a long time, however, the check operation is performed
synchronously, in order to provide better and quicker failure
conditions to the user.

Closes-bug: #1455460

Change-Id: Ie814331b9ddaab2762282a45ba1cdc7065f7e157

commit_message:
Re-enable encrypted volume tests for ceph

Due to a bug we had to disable the encrypted Cinder volume tests in Tempest
initially.

The nova fix is tracked in change: I4b5c65d6c719a837674a1809dd1cec12c0df1ebc

Once that gets merged we can re-enable the tests.

Change-Id: Ic36eb8195b57778687dcf362256e1d5f069c8ab6
Related-Bug: #1463525

commit_message:
Allow monitor plugins to set own object fields

This patchset renames the base monitor plugin get_metric()
abstract method to populate_metric_object() and passes
MontiorMetric object as an additional parameter to the method.
This allows individual monitor plugin to set their MonitorMetric
object fields in their plugin code itself.

Additionally, updated the cpu monitor plugin to reflect the change.

Change-Id: I1e05413486b6ab037887a53f9b54b2470a97d698
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/72/214772/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_metric(self, name, metric_object): metric_object.name = name metric_object.value = self._data[name] metric_object.timestamp = self._data["timestamp"] metric_object.source = self.source return metric_object
deleted_lines: def get_metric(self, name): return self._data[name], self._data["timestamp"]

commit_message:
Show up a Tempest test to create 1 instance with multi-nics on same net

Nova commit 322cc9336fe6f6fe9b3f0da33c6b26a3e5ea9b0c added the
neutron.allow_duplicate_networks config option in Juno and it defaults
to False.

This will show up a Tempest test for this feature. For now,
this test is skipped if the config option (to be deprecated
in Kilo with Nova change Ideeb3c137ff68a4497189670be33f6edbb0ccb76)
is not set to True. This skip will be removed and
always tested once the config option will be removed in Liberty.

Depends-On: I05f81d86cde249c23be06d5804fadbf40fc4a7f3

Change-Id: I059976e9949c2cc8fa32978ad051b37417650859
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/96/164396/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test.idempotent_id('1678d144-ed74-43f8-8e57-ab10dbf9b3c2') @testtools.skipUnless(CONF.service_available.neutron, 'Neutron service must be available.') @testtools.skipUnless(CONF.compute_feature_enabled. allow_duplicate_networks, 'Duplicate networks must ' 'be allowed (remove skip in Liberty)') def test_verify_duplicate_network_nics(self): # Verify that server creation does not fail when more than one nic # is created on the same network. name_net1 = data_utils.rand_name(self.__class__.__name__) net1 = self.network_client.create_network(name=name_net1) self.addCleanup(self.network_client.delete_network, net1['network']['id']) subnet1 = self.network_client.create_subnet( network_id=net1['network']['id'], cidr='19.80.0.0/24', ip_version=4) self.addCleanup(self.network_client.delete_subnet, subnet1['subnet']['id']) name_net2 = data_utils.rand_name(self.__class__.__name__) net2 = self.network_client.create_network(name=name_net2) self.addCleanup(self.network_client.delete_network, net2['network']['id']) subnet2 = self.network_client.create_subnet( network_id=net2['network']['id'], cidr='19.86.0.0/24', ip_version=4) self.addCleanup(self.network_client.delete_subnet, subnet2['subnet']['id']) networks = [{'uuid': net1['network']['id']}, {'uuid': net2['network']['id']}, {'uuid': net1['network']['id']}] server_multi_nics = self.create_test_server( networks=networks, wait_until='ACTIVE') def cleanup_server(): self.client.delete_server(server_multi_nics['id']) self.client.wait_for_server_termination(server_multi_nics['id']) self.addCleanup(cleanup_server) addresses = self.client.list_addresses(server_multi_nics['id']) addr = [addresses[name_net1][0]['addr'], addresses[name_net2][0]['addr'], addresses[name_net1][1]['addr']] networks = [netaddr.IPNetwork('19.80.0.0/24'), netaddr.IPNetwork('19.86.0.0/24'), netaddr.IPNetwork('19.80.0.0/24')] for address, network in zip(addr, networks): self.assertIn(address, network)

commit_message:
Test for resize instance booted from volume

Added test for action resize instance booted from volume.

Change-Id: Ic439c77de1c22dd974be0ff27d79d4cca945842e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/29/157729/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tempest.scenario import managerclass ServerActionsTestJSON(base.BaseV2ComputeTest, manager.ScenarioTest): def _create_volume_from_image(self): img_uuid = CONF.compute.image_ref vol_name = data_utils.rand_name('volume-origin') return self.create_volume(name=vol_name, imageRef=img_uuid) def _boot_instance_from_volume(self, vol_id, keypair): # NOTE(gfidente): the syntax for block_device_mapping is # dev_name=id:type:size:delete_on_terminate # where type needs to be "snap" if the server is booted # from a snapshot, size instead can be safely left empty bd_map = [{ 'device_name': 'vda', 'volume_id': vol_id, 'boot_index': '0', 'delete_on_termination': '0'}] self.security_group = self._create_security_group() security_groups = [{'name': self.security_group['name']}] create_kwargs = { 'block_device_mapping': bd_map, 'key_name': keypair['name'], 'security_groups': security_groups } return self.create_server(image='', flavor='451', create_kwargs=create_kwargs) def test_resize_server_booted_from_volume(self): keypair = self.create_keypair() self.security_group = self._create_security_group() # create an instance from volume volume_origin = self._create_volume_from_image() server = self._boot_instance_from_volume(volume_origin['id'], keypair) previous_flavor_ref, new_flavor_ref = ( self._detect_server_image_flavor(server['id'])) resp, body = self.client.resize(server['id'], new_flavor_ref) self.assertEqual(202, resp.status) self.client.wait_for_server_status(server['id'], 'VERIFY_RESIZE') self.client.confirm_resize(server['id']) expected_status = 'ACTIVE' self.client.wait_for_server_status(server['id'], expected_status)

commit_message:
apply endpoint_group filters on token catalog

The spec of endpoint-group-filter
1a67fa47cf56489bf60f5b68f6c565e8bf2da701 says endpoint-group-filter
should reduce the size of the service catalog included in project
scoped tokens. But, currently, it doesn't, because we don't apply
endpoint_group filters on token catalog.

Change-Id: I0df9778eeee2a6722e4526b79d295c532b469e10
Closes-Bug: #1405574

added_lines: refs = self.endpoint_filter_api.list_filterd_endpoints_for_project( project_id) context, refs)
deleted_lines: refs = self.endpoint_filter_api.list_endpoints_for_project(project_id) filtered_endpoints = dict( (ref['endpoint_id'], self.catalog_api.get_endpoint( ref['endpoint_id'])) for ref in refs) # need to recover endpoint_groups associated with project # then for each endpoint group return the endpoints. endpoint_groups = self._get_endpoint_groups_for_project(project_id) for endpoint_group in endpoint_groups: endpoint_refs = self._get_endpoints_filtered_by_endpoint_group( endpoint_group['id']) # now check if any endpoints for current endpoint group are not # contained in the list of filtered endpoints for endpoint_ref in endpoint_refs: if endpoint_ref['id'] not in filtered_endpoints: filtered_endpoints[endpoint_ref['id']] = endpoint_ref context, [v for v in six.itervalues(filtered_endpoints)])

commit_message:
supports lbaas alembic migration for db2

This patch adds the optional runtime dependency to support db2
for alembic migration, will not break the default mysql path.

This is needed for the IBM DB2 third party CI to work on this
project.

There will be a related patch in the main neutron project.

Change-Id: I9db112dbdc2d02df88ad676a6b21018f1d6f1724
Closes-Bug: 1442524
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas refs/changes/32/174232/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: # NOTE(songli): This is to register the DB2 alembic code which # is an optional runtime dependency. from ibm_db_alembic.ibm_db import IbmDbImpl # noqa except ImportError: pass

commit_message:
Return HTTPForbidden if over quota

According to following guide line
https://github.com/openstack/api-wg/blob/master/guidelines/http.rst
we should return HTTPForbidden instead of HTTPBadRequest
if the quota is over.

per
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/api_microversion_dev.html#f2
this doesn't need a microversion bump.

Change-Id: Ic72501fbe0a1c761890d498f483e99d106bd7804
Closes-Bug: 1451991
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/69/180469/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.assertRaises(webob.exc.HTTPForbidden,

commit_message:
Update name validation with expanded characters

Based on the unicode chart, there are printable characters outside
of the 0xFFFF range. We should allow those printable characters
when creating flavors.
Unicode chart: http://www.unicode.org/Public/UCD/latest/charts/CodeCharts.pdf

Change-Id: Icb1af52d61def886ec115f3d883f5ac58132e7f7
Closes-Bug: #1499091
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/39/227039/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Names with printable characters outside of 0xFFFF range flavors.create(u'm1.\U0002000B_1', 1, 2, 1024) # Name contains non printable characters outside of 0xFFFF range self.assertInvalidInput(u'm1.\U0001D173_1', 1, 2, 1024)

commit_message:
Add unit tests for nova.virt.firewall.IpTablesFirewallDriver

There is no unit tests for the base IptablesFirewallDriver.
This patch contains a start of those unit tests.

Co-Authored-By: Jay Pipes <jaypipes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit Ia9ef5ead95508cfb27b53b9899a9cfe97d150662)
Partial-bug: #1295889

Change-Id: Ie2827051e1795c717f8a7762b932a49d182891cd

commit_message:
Switch default keystone auth_uri to v3

NOTE: we keep the inspector (client) auth URLs at v2.0 until it
properly handles v3 support. See LP bug:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic-inspector/+bug/1531236

This change should allow keystone v3 as a default in most cases.
Our goal is to move towards using a versionless keystone auth_uri but
some clients still don't support that yet either so for now we hard
code to /v3 (similar to v2.0).

Change-Id: I55518994bcea1c1b9067912baf32919b692fb0c2
(cherry picked from commit 32d600a2b61aaff430f3a3298f316d85bb6b2369)

Workaround package bug and include keystone client

around this packaging issue by adding it here.

commit_message:
Documentation tox fix

Added information about debugging unit test with tox.
Replace 3 references to py26 with py34 to reflect current
rally tox configuration.

Co-Authored-By: Illia Khudoshyn <ikhudoshyn@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I10c865fae473111b35dca1b9c8f51f31ba066b42
closes-bug: 1547265
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/18/282118/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 8. Run the test suite locally to make sure nothing broke, e.g. (this will run py34/py27/pep8 tests):To run py34, py27 or pep8 only: #NOTE: <name> is one of py34, py27 or pep8 To run a single unit test e.g. test_deployment .. code-block:: console $ tox -e <name> -- <test_name> #NOTE: <name> is one of py34, py27 or pep8 # <test_name> is the unit test case name To debug issues on the unit test: - Add breakpoints on the test file using ``import pdb;`` ``pdb.set_trace()`` - Then run tox in debug mode: .. code-block:: console $ tox -e debug
deleted_lines: 8. Run the test suite locally to make sure nothing broke, e.g. (this will run py26/py27/pep8 tests):To run py26, py27 or pep8 only: #NOTE: <name> is one of py26, py27 or pep8

commit_message:
Scaling hyperv neutron agent

This blueprint spec discusses the scale issues
with respect hyperv neutron agent and proposes
solution for the same.

Implements: blueprint scale-hyperv-neutron-agent

Co-Authored-By: Sonu Sudhakaran <sonu.sudhakaran@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Vinod Kumar <vinod.kumar5@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Claudiu Belu <cbelu@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Change-Id: I646d7898eab15f3c144dd5e9dae147093c2eb913
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-hyperv refs/changes/58/214958/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Scale Hyper-V Neutron Agent ========================================== Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/networking-hyperv/+spec/scale-hyperv-neutron-agent A typical medium sized hybrid cloud deployment consists of more than 50 Hyper-V compute nodes along with computes like KVM or ESX. The rate at which VMs are spawned/updated under such a deployment is around 25 operations/minute. And these operations consists of spawning, updation and deletion of the VM and its properties (like security group rules). At this rate the possibility of concurrent spawn or update operations on a given compute is High. What is typically observed is a spawn rate of ~2 VM(s)/minute. Since WMI is not that performant, a VM port binding in Hyper-V neutron agent takes 10x amount of time when compared to KVM IPtable. The situation worsens when the number of SG Rules to apply increases for a given port (with the number of SG members), and there are many ports in queue to treat. Under such a scenario neutron agent running on Hyper-v compute fails to complete binding security rules to the VM port in given time,and VM remains in-accessible on the allocated IP address. This blueprint addresses the neutron port binding failure on the agent by introducing port binding concurrency. Problem Description =================== Under enterprise class cloud environment the possibility of single compute receiving more than one VM spawn request grows. It is nova scheduler that chooses the compute node on which the VM will be spawned. The neutron part on compute node runs as an independent task which does the port related configuration for the spawned VM. Today neutron agent runs in a multi threaded environment, out of this multiple threads main thread is responsible for doing the port binding (i.e. vlan configuration and applying port rules) for the spawned VM and sending agent keep alive message to controller. The second thread is responsible for processing the port updates(i.e. updating port acls/rules). The threading mechanism is implemented using python's green thread library, the green thread by nature operated in run till completion or preemption mode, which means that a green thread will not yield the CPU until it completes its job or it is preempted explicitly. The above mentioned nature of green thread impacts the Hyper-V scale. The problem starts when a compute already has around 15 VMs hosted and security group update is in process, at the same time neutron agent's deamon loop wakes up and finds that there were ports added for which binding is pending. Because the update thread is holding the CPU, the port binding main thread will not get turn to execute resulting in delayed port binding. Since Nova agent runs in isolation independent of neutron it will not wait for neutron to complete port binding and will power on the VM. The booted VM will start sending the DHCP discovery which ultimately gets dropped resulting in VM not getting DHCP IP. The problem becomes worse with growing number of VMs because more VMs in network mean more time to complete port update, and the list of added ports pending for port binding also grows due to arrival of new VMs. This will finally result in agent missing to send keep alive to controller resulting in agent down. Proposed Change =============== This blueprint proposes solution to the above discussed problem in two parts. The first part is to introduce synchronization mechanism between nova and neutron agent. Here we can introduce the existing 'vif' notification concept where nova will wait for neutron notification. Only after receiving the vif notification from neutron nova will boot/power on the hosted VM. The neutron agent will generate the notification after it completes the port binding. This approach will not solve the complete problem as nova will wait for neutron notification for a specified time interval (max of 300s). Observations from various experiments done has revealed that since neutron agent processes the port one after another sequentially, and since the security group updates are handled in the same neutron-agent process which treats new ports, the time it could take to process the newly added port could range in between 3-20 minutes(*), resulting in VMs not completing binding of rules within the timeout. (*)time varies quadraticly when SG rules increases, and number of VMs/compute increases The second part of proposal is to spawn independent controlled short lived processes to process port binding such that it is not limited by threading within the same process which is otherwise subject to preemption. And since these processes are shortlived, and spawned on demand (a new port added) it doesn't incur much overhead on the Compute, but completes the Job rather efficiently and quickly. The scope of the new process is limited to applying port VLAN configuration and applying first set of security group rules applicable to the port, and finally do the device up RPC to a trigger vif notification to nova. The advantage of carrying out the port binding in separate process context is that port binding and port update can go in parallel independent of each other, and also under scale environment multiple ports can be processed in parallel compare to sequential. We will use existing python eventlet's subprocess library to concurrently carry out the port binding. For every new port arriving, a new subprocess will be spawned which will take port id as input, complete the binding and communicate the result back to parent (which is the main thread). In case of failure the parent will retry the binding by restarting the same process. Couple of new config parameter will be introduced to control the maximum number of concurrent binding and to control the number of retries on failure. Following are the new config variable introduced for neutron agent with the default values. worker_count=10 worker_retry=3 Data Model Impact ----------------- None REST API Impact --------------- None Security Impact --------------- None Notifications Impact -------------------- Neutron will notify device up to nova. Other End User Impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ This changes will improve the Hyper-V neutron agent performance. One process per port will be spawned for newly added port. IPv6 Impact ----------- Should not have any impact on IPv6. Other Deployer Impact --------------------- The deployment will not have any impact. Following new config parameters are introduced for neutron agent. worker_count=10 worker_retry=3 Developer Impact ---------------- None Community Impact ---------------- Scaling Openstack neutron is always a challenge and this change will allow Hyper-V neutron to scale around 1000 VM with 10 tenants Alternatives ------------ The proposed solution is an appropriate one as we tried and tested it with Juno release and it actually did scale to bigger number. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: <sonu.sudhakaran@hp.com> <vinod.kumar5@hp.com> Other contributors: <krishna.kanth-mallela@hp.com > Work Items ---------- * Minor change eventlet package * Writing wrapper on top of sobprocess * Breaking Hyper-V neutron agent code into two parent and child context. * Implementing neutron and nova notification mechanism. * Writing unit test. * Writing tempest. * Functionality testing. * Scale testing. Dependencies ============ * Eventlet library modification. * Nova to process neutron vif notification. Testing ======= The changes will be tested by deploying cloud with around 20 computes nodes and spawning 1000 VMs at concurrency of 6 VMs per minute for overall cloud with 10 tenants each having their own network. Tempest Tests ------------- TBD Functional Tests ---------------- TBD API Tests --------- None Documentation Impact ==================== Capture the new config variables. User Documentation ------------------ Capture the new config variables. Developer Documentation ----------------------- Capture the new config variables. References ========== None

commit_message:
Fix exported symbol in identity.v3

A , was missing so the strings were just concatenated in __all__.
This caused the TokenMethod and OidcAuthorizationCode symbols to not
be exported.

Change-Id: I692501849f9f7854383be95cea02e84f7a2a99d4

The DiskFilter, RamFilter and CoreFilter scheduler filters set the
resource limit on the HostState object during filtering. This is
later checked in compute during the claim, and used to enforce
the allocation ratios in a safe manner. The Exact* filters do not
set the resource limits, so scheduler race conditions can result
in multiple bare metal instances claiming a single host.

This change sets the resource limits on the HostState object in
the ExactCoreFilter, ExactDiskFilter and ExactRamFilter, ensuring

commit_message:
Apply scheduler limits to Exact* filters

The DiskFilter, RamFilter and CoreFilter scheduler filters set the
resource limit on the HostState object during filtering. This is
later checked in compute during the claim, and used to enforce
the allocation ratios in a safe manner. The Exact* filters do not
set the resource limits, so scheduler race conditions can result
in multiple bare metal instances claiming a single host.

This change sets the resource limits on the HostState object in
the ExactCoreFilter, ExactDiskFilter and ExactRamFilter, ensuring
that only a single baremetal instance can claim a compute host.

 Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/scheduler/filters/test_exact_core_filter.py
	nova/tests/unit/scheduler/filters/test_exact_disk_filter.py
	nova/tests/unit/scheduler/filters/test_exact_ram_filter.py

Change-Id: I31d0331afc4698046a4568935a95f70f30e335dd
Partial-Bug: #1341420
Co-Authored-By: Will Miller <wmiller@cray.com>
(cherry picked from commit 3471cc8b74444d04348d8e6dbc9c980641d4b0bc)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/91/276191/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(mgoddard): Setting the limit ensures that it is enforced in # compute. This ensures that if multiple instances are scheduled to a # single host, then all after the first will fail in the claim. host_state.limits['disk_gb'] = host_state.total_usable_disk_gb

commit_message:
Encode headers to launch glance v2 on mod_wsgi

Some headers in v2 are unicode string and they cannot be
recognized by mod_wsgi. So encode all headers as utf-8 to allow
users to use glance under Apache mod_wsgi or other wsgi
frameworks.  v1 functionality already encoded headers as utf-8.

APIImpact
Closes-bug: #1508880
Change-Id: Ifa83ed3ab44a4b7f98e438c74d889a956703cf4a

commit_message:
Remove Horizon scss variables: $code-font-family

There are many variables inside of
openstack_dashboard/static/dashboard/scss/_variables.scss that are
unnecessary or actually prohibit themability. These should be removed.

partial-bug: #1551492

Change-Id: I98bc0f37b5e622ce2206bff6a0465c8a78692b3a

commit_message:
Catch iscsi VolumeDeviceNotFound when detaching

If exceptions are raised, nova-compute can't start
when executing _destroy_evacuated_instances.

Change-Id: I0a2877ec0f922d2bc9a742d1c2c2540a6b77e9ce
Closes-Bug: #1532657

commit_message:
Use imageutils from oslo.utils

We clean up oslo-incubator in 90ae25e38915cc502d9e9c52d59e8fb668a72ae1,
and sync imageutils to oslo.utis with unittest in version 3.1.
openstack/common/imageutils.py exists without unittest. Let's switch
to use oslo.utils' imageutils.

Change-Id: Iac3b221d7ad16c16866dc6b11f08afc473da9bc9

commit_message:
Check for service existance in capabilities API

We have to return 404 error code if requested backend
is not found and 502 if request failed with timeout.

APIImpact

Closes-Bug: #1520077

commit_message:
Add check for listener's admin_state_up status

Add check for listener's admin_state_up status, so that
only listener which admin_state_up==True can be write to
the haproxy config file.

Change-Id: I4b27cb0638fbd7f8d59829e8ddce8e7387b5f390
Closes-Bug: #1533108

added_lines: listeners = [] for x in loadbalancer.listeners: if x.admin_state_up: listeners.append(_transform_listener(x, haproxy_base_dir))
deleted_lines: listeners = [_transform_listener( x, haproxy_base_dir) for x in loadbalancer.listeners]

commit_message:
Clean up unnecessary import of urlparse module

six.moves.urllib already covers the py2 and py3 compatibility issues
of urlparse module, use six.moves.urllib.parse.urlparse is enough.

Change-Id: I785f4f872850e5d770fdcf4c0d3392be3978cc4a

deleted_lines: try: from urllib.parse import urlparse # noqa except ImportError: from urlparse import urlparse # noqa url_parts = urlparse(self.endpoint)

commit_message:
Add delete load balancer actions

This adds the single and multiple load balancer delete actions. A
load balancer must be in ACTIVE or ERROR state in order for the
delete action to be available. If a load balancer has a listener the
delete request will currently fail, but future work should allow for
the listener and any related resources to also be deleted.

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-lbaas-v2-ui
Change-Id: I3902587089963318c49a969f343e5043d8bdaf50

added_lines: /* * Copyright 2016 IBM Corp. * * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the 'License'); * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. * You may obtain a copy of the License at * * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 * * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software * distributed under the License is distributed on an 'AS IS' BASIS, * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and * limitations under the License. */ (function() { 'use strict'; angular .module('horizon.dashboard.project.lbaasv2.loadbalancers') .factory('horizon.dashboard.project.lbaasv2.loadbalancers.actions.delete', deleteService); deleteService.$inject = [ '$q', '$location', '$route', 'horizon.framework.widgets.modal.deleteModalService', 'horizon.app.core.openstack-service-api.lbaasv2', 'horizon.app.core.openstack-service-api.policy', 'horizon.framework.util.q.extensions', 'horizon.framework.util.i18n.gettext' ]; /** * @ngDoc factory * @name horizon.dashboard.project.lbaasv2.loadbalancers.actions.deleteService * @description * Brings up the delete load balancer confirmation modal dialog. * On submit, deletes the load balancer. * On cancel, does nothing. * @param $q The angular service for promises. * @param $location The angular $location service. * @param $route The angular $route service. * @param deleteModal The horizon delete modal service. * @param api The LBaaS v2 API service. * @param policy The horizon policy service. * @param qExtensions Horizon extensions to the $q service. * @param gettext The horizon gettext function for translation. * @returns The load balancers table row delete service. */ function deleteService($q, $location, $route, deleteModal, api, policy, qExtensions, gettext) { var context = { labels: { title: gettext('Confirm Delete Load Balancer'), /* eslint-disable max-len */ message: gettext('You have selected "%s". Please confirm your selection. Deleted load balancers are not recoverable.'), /* eslint-enable max-len */ submit: gettext('Delete Load Balancer'), success: gettext('Deleted load balancer: %s.'), error: gettext('Unable to delete load balancer: %s.') }, deleteEntity: deleteItem }; var service = { perform: perform, allowed: allowed }; return service; ////////////// function perform(item) { deleteModal.open({ $emit: actionComplete }, [item], context); } function allowed(item) { return $q.all([ qExtensions.booleanAsPromise(['ACTIVE', 'ERROR'].indexOf(item.provisioning_status) > -1), qExtensions.booleanAsPromise(item.listeners.length === 0), // This rule is made up and should therefore always pass. At some point there will // likely be a valid rule similar to this that we will want to use. policy.ifAllowed({ rules: [['neutron', 'delete_loadbalancer']] }) ]); } function deleteItem(id) { return api.deleteLoadBalancer(id, true); } function actionComplete() { if (/\/ngloadbalancersv2(\/)?$/.test($location.path())) { $route.reload(); } else { $location.path('project/ngloadbalancersv2'); } } } })();

commit_message:
Add notes on running the upgrade script

This patch adds instructions for running the upgrade script for Kilo to
Liberty.

Manual steps for running the upgrade are not yet included.

Change-Id: I5f3e048bf9f9ddc80925d4dc9acfc3f946513823
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/19/285419/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Running the Upgrade Script -------------------------- The code for performing a migration from Kilo to Libery resides in the Liberty series releases of OpenStack-Ansible. To perform an upgrade from Kilo to Liberty, perform the following steps in the ``openstack-ansible`` directory: .. code-block:: bash git checkout <liberty-tag> ./scripts/run-upgrade.sh

commit_message:
Isolate DSE2 tests from one another

Add a parameter to the DseNode constructor that is folded into the
oslo-messaging topic names to allow all tests to be completely
isolated from each other, even when run in parallel.

Modify tests to use that parameter.

Pull original test_dse_node into tests2 as well.

Change-Id: I5629e3426b83c57643296c41b81ee827087493be

commit_message:
[install] make the "local_ip" explanation more detailed

Reader of the install guide reported ambiguity about
what OVERLAY_INTERFACE_IP_ADDRESS means. We should make
it more clear.

backport: liberty

Change-Id: I480205217a9cf32eec06a545966e62ead7eb4744
Closes-Bug: #1550500
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/34/285634/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: example architecture uses the management interface to tunnel traffic to the other nodes. So replce ``OVERLAY_INTERFACE_IP_ADDRESS`` with the management IP address of the each node itself.
deleted_lines: example architecture uses the management interface.

commit_message:
Add service dimension

Service dimension is missing in Directory and FileSize Plugins
Default service name for directory and filesize plugin should be
uncategorized

Change-Id: Id80b3f87c5d08d7055017b2595c35552cfad67b4

commit_message:
Adding integration test support

* Update requirements for selenium testing
* Add gate scripts
* Add draft integration test config and test stub
* Update tox for running integration tests

A patch for gate job is: I76ab460a110d93b0186ca126858f79ac9e89f09b

Change-Id: I5ca1bf7003a9882648cdfbeab21d2ada37b951f1

commit_message:
glance: support relying on tags to extract image id

Deprecated amp_image_id option with the new amp_image_tag option.

Also switched devstack plugin to rely on the tag to update the image
used for new load balancers.

Implements: blueprint use-glance-tags-to-manage-image
Change-Id: Ibc28b2220565667e15ca2b2674e55074d6126ec3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/90/284690/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import glanceclient # noqa def _extract_amp_image_id_by_tag(self, tag): # construct keystone client # fetch glance endpoint details from catalog # construct glance client # fetch list of images with the tag # if len(images) > 1: # raise # return image.id return 'fakeid' def _get_image_uuid(self): image_id = CONF.controller_worker.amp_image_id if image_id: return image_id tag = CONF.controller_worker.amp_image_tag return self._extract_amp_image_id_by_tag(tag) image_id=self._get_image_uuid(),

commit_message:
RST directive to discover and generate drivers doc

This patchset introduces a new custom directive called 'drivers-doc'
which loads all available drivers under a given namespace and import
their respective docstring into the .rst document.

This patchset also contains some modification/addition to the
docstring of these drivers to make the final document complete.

Change-Id: Ib3df59fa45cea9d11d20fb73a5f0f1d564135bca
Closes-Bug: #1536218
Closes-Bug: #1536735

commit_message:
Updated Watcher doc to mention Tempest tests

The Watcher Tempest tests are only mentioned inside a README.rst.
They are now part of the main documentation.

Change-Id: Ieca85dc7f7307b45e4b99af4a4600a8c2d2b59d7
Closes-Bug: #1536993
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/watcher refs/changes/32/283032/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Run Watcher tests ================= Watcher provides both :ref:`unit tests <unit_tests>` and :ref:`functional/tempest tests <tempest_tests>`. Please refer to :doc:`testing` to understand how to run them.
deleted_lines: Run Watcher unit tests ====================== All unit tests should be run using tox. To run the unit tests under py27 and also run the pep8 tests: .. code-block:: bash $ workon watcher (watcher) $ pip install tox (watcher) $ cd watcher (watcher) $ tox -epep8 -epy27 You may pass options to the test programs using positional arguments. To run a specific unit test, this passes the -r option and desired test (regex string) to os-testr: .. code-block:: bash $ workon watcher (watcher) $ tox -epy27 -- tests.api When you're done, deactivate the virtualenv: .. code-block:: bash $ deactivate
